Save the time and spend it more on youtube or other wbsite in learning how to take good photograph in night time or in day light or during portrait.

Reviews.Title: Love touch screen and new STM lens.  Not so sure about low light performance
Reviews.Author: ES123
Reviews.Content: I've had T2i for a while and was looking to upgrade to a newer camera.  The main reason I decided to upgrade to T4i was for its reported better low light performance.  I like to take photos without flash and often in very low light situations.T2i already does a very good job in low light situations but when I read that T4i was better, I decided to purchase this camera.I've only had it for a day but when I took it for a test drive yesterday, I wasn't impressed with its performance with ISO 3400 and up.  I couldn't really see a visible difference in the quality compared to what I was able to achieve with T2i.  It's quite possible that it does have slight better IQ at ISO 3400 and higher but it wasn't noticeable.However, I did notice an improvement in color saturation and loved the touch screen functions.STM lens is a HUGE improvement as well.  It focuses fast without the grinding noise that Canon's EF and EF S lenses make.If I had not sold my T2i, I would have returned T4i and just purchased STM lens separately.t4i is a solid camera with improved functions and I highly recommend it.  For my particular needs, I would have kept T2i.

Reviews.Title: Excellent DSLR Camera!!
Reviews.Author: LA John
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for over a year now. I've already shot well over 15,000 photos and it still takes excellent photos with no issues. The camera and it's 18-135mm bundle lens is so well built. I got a lot of compliments from many people and I got people buying the same model too. :) The picture quality is very sharp and vivid and it's continuous auto focus video is no joke. The price of this dslr might be entry-level, but it takes professional quality photos and videos. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: great beginner
Reviews.Author: Tevin Mills
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera to begin your journey as a photographer, paired with some good glass this camera works wonders and can produce great professional quality work. Love the touch screen design.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Nguyen
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and i am very satisfied, everything is perfect, the touchscreen is very responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: excellent seller
Reviews.Author: Boony Andrade Pacheco
Reviews.Content: excellent producer all in perfect condition and mind totally new package, highly recommended Very good product thank you very much

Reviews.Title: diamond in the rough
Reviews.Author: vlagga
Reviews.Content: i lucked out on this deal,the price was right , the item arrived on time and it's working great well worth it

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Ramzes
Reviews.Content: I like this camera so far.Did not have any problems with it.Bought is last summer,still using it and very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: My first SLR Camera and I love it
Reviews.Author: Naren
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer and so I cannot talk about the technical details. I use this camera on all my trips and the photos are amazing. They are really toooo good.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Amanda May
Reviews.Content: I use this camera in my gym and it is great. I love using it for HD video. So easy to use!

Reviews.Title: You'll never want a better camera!
Reviews.Author: John Carpenter
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures, wonderful touch screen, awesome zoom lens, amazing clarity, easy to create 1080 HD video! I like the swivel out screen, too.Highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: cathy
Reviews.Content: Im totally an amateur picture taker and have no comments on all the features which it has ALOT of.  its fast and the pictures are the most awesome.  the auto function during video can be kind of loud but its HD video...seriously its nice.  we have a SDXC 64GB card in it (yes you HAVE to have a card) and it holds more than enough video and pictures for our family and is pretty darn fast.  the Walmart in our town doesn't have a machine that can read it though to get pictures printed off but our new Dell computer can read them and its awesome...otherwise have to use the cable.  pictures are hard to send through email cause they are HUGE files..or im not tech savvy enough to send them an easier way to family and friends.  still love this camera... again the pictures are awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph V. Mcnamara
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I have the Rebel XTi also and lenses are all interchangeable. The HD video is awesome and the large  3" LCD monitor is great for video. Size and feel are great and price is competitive.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We love our camera.  It is makes shooting photos of our daughter really easy.  The auto zoom is quick and works great taking video.  We like to bird watch in our backyard, and this camera gives us a great opportunity to take pictures of the birds in our backyard.  Using the various functions is pretty easy.  The instructions are clear and gives good explanations for how to use the different functions.  When my parents came to visit for Christmas they loved it so much they traded in their point and shoot for a T4i!  This camera is definitely worth buying.  It is a welcome upgrade from a fixed lens camera.  Certainly for more diverse picture taking you may need to buy different lenses, but we are happy with the lens that came with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Better than
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Silva de Lima Rocha
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!It really does the job for a person that does not have a good understanding in taking semi-pro pictures.I used a lot only on the manual settings and after one week I could create very nice pics but I still have a lot to learn on this field.Get a Sandisk card with it so you will not have problems taking several pics straight or making movies in 1080p.

Reviews.Title: Its a steal!
Reviews.Author: critical thinker
Reviews.Content: If you can still find one at the reduced, clearance price, buy it!  Sure the early ones off the assembly line had some problems, but not the later ones (do your research and find the model numbers to avoid).  This is a great camera with great features and the lens on this kit is super as well.  Better than the T3i and cheaper than the t5i (that added little of value).  It's a Canon!  Unfortunately, it just didn't recover from some early problems and is being discontinued.

Reviews.Title: Wow! The quality is very good
Reviews.Author: Chris Smith "cx2smith"
Reviews.Content: Photo quality with the 4Ti is really good. If you are comfortable with an SLR and not intimidated by a ton of options you should buy this camera. Great still, even in automatic modes and the video quality is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: handy camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "tcsd38"
Reviews.Content: Having been a Canon camera person for many years I decided to go with this, It's my 3rd digital, so I had an idea what to look for and the price was in my affordable range. Range finder and SLR combined, if you have no idea what I'm talking about, just know this is a complex, but simple too, camera. You can go automatic and let the tool decide or pretend you have some control over the artistic process. Between this tool and Photoshop how can anyone screw up an image, well sharp focus can elude some of us...and tripods, well anyhow for the average user I don't think you can go wrong with this item. Semi-pro, or pro?  Get a large memeory card and I always carry an extra battery, although I've never burned through a charge completely yet.Lighter than my old EF, lenses from that era fit, but without the modern designs,

Reviews.Title: The product was perfectly described
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Quesada
Reviews.Content: The camera was as espected, works perfectly with out any damages, the shipment was really fast, lasting only 2 days from the US to Spain.

Reviews.Title: Perfect DSLR for the person looking to jump from point and shoot to the real thing.
Reviews.Author: M909
Reviews.Content: I have always loved photography and wanted to make the jump from a nice point and shoot to a DSLR with some serious options.  I purchased the Cannon Rebel T4I and have loved it.  You can read the features above but what I like most about the camera is its ease of use and options.  Out of the box, and with little practice, you can do a lot with the camera. After a few weeks with it you will want to learn more about how to truly use the camera. It shoots great in auto mode, but at some point you will want to get more creative. If you buy this, you MUST WATCH this video. [...] the guy goes through every single setting, knob, function, and tells you what it is and how to use it. HIGHLY recommend watching it.  You can then take that knowledge and watch more videos on how to do different types of shots.I'm no pro, just really enjoy taking pictures and have loved this camera. I'm learning something new about it ever time I take it out.  This was a big purchase for me so I also bought a camera bag to protect.  I got this one Lowepro SlingShot 102 AW on Amazon for half of what it cost at a store and have loved it.The only negative I had with this camera is that it didnt have a time-lapse setting. I purchased: B003Q9RERY to solve the problem. A very cheap and easy solution. There is a cheap remote on the market as well.

Reviews.Title: An incredible DSLR for starting out or upgrading from an earlier Canon model
Reviews.Author: James Klaproth
Reviews.Content: Canon refurbished products are wonderful because they arrive just like a new camera and they now give you a full 1 year warranty! I would buy these products in a heartbeat any time. This is an amazing camera - I sold my Canon XSi and got this body - a major step up for an entry-level camera. The touchscreen is a must have, the ability to shoot HD video is great, and the articulating monitor screen is fantastic. One downside for shooting video is Canon's older lenses make a lot of focusing noise when you continuosly autofocus, so the new Canon STM lenses are a must for video. The T4i is almost identical to the newer model, the T5i, so I do not see myself stepping up to this camera; however I may step up to the new Canon EOS 70D in the future as it is another step up from the T4i. If you are a beginner to DSLRs, I highly recommend this camera over the T5i or any of Canon's earlier models. Buy it refurbished from Canon and save major bucks. You won't be sorry

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR.....and I am thrilled. As the say a picture is worth a thousand words....these pics are worth even more!
Reviews.Author: lthj75 "lthj75"
Reviews.Content: Great camera and lens combo!  Got some awesome shots of my kids on the field that I wouldn't have gotten with my canon G9. This set up with the 55-250 zoom lens makes the perfect set up for any parent. Knowing I would want to dtake video, I made sure I got the EF-S 18-135is with the T4i body when I bought the camera. The 2 lenses make a killer duo!  I have no regrets and would recommend this set up to anyone and everyone.My one regret?  No taking the plunge sooner!Hope this helps anyone debating this camera. As they say, just do it!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Josh  Wallingford
Reviews.Content: Powerful, great with the lens upgrade.A dual battery pack and the wall plug are must-have accessories though. Shooting video blows through power and causes the camera to heat up quite a bit.I've shot with it all over the world in many different lighting conditions and for the money, it's a great unit.

Reviews.Title: Very nice consumer camera
Reviews.Author: Trudi James
Reviews.Content: I find this camera easy to use, easy to hold, lightweight to pack around, and it takes great photos.  Not a full sensor camera, but enough data in the raw photos to get very nice enlargements.  The options for still photography are good.  There are enough choices for customizing and for letting the camera make the exposure for the camera operator. The swing-out, and rotatable screen is really wonderful.  Being able to use the live view on the screen, while holding the camera where my eye has trouble getting (like very high, or very low) is wonderful. The magnification on the live view for focusing on exactly what I want, has also been very useful and even fun.  Shooting from the screen, can be useful with mostly still objects, but doesn't work fast enough for tracking children, for example.  Overall the screen's extra functionality and versatility really tops off the quality of the CMOS sensor with 18MP recording. The video, however, leaves a lot to be desired.  The visual quality is ok, but the camera picks up the sound of the very slow focusing mechanism in the lens and makes nature filming pointless.  I feel like I still need to get a video camera to carry along side of this still camera and am disappointed that Cannon used up space and weight for that function if they didn't intend for it to be as useful as the still photography aspect.

Reviews.Title: Awesome seller for an awesome product
Reviews.Author: Kera
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. And I love Cameta Caera. They promptly shipped my camera and it arrived on Christmas Eve. My friends dad recommended them to me and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a camera.That being said I love my camera. I had wanted a DSLR camera for a couple of years and finally bit the bullet and purchased one. I haven't used it that much but the pictures I have taken are pretty awesome. I wanted it to use at the races (we're avid NASCAR fans who attend at least 2 races a year) and other than forgetting that my I had it in manuel mode, which I had set up for the night racing, and I used that while taking pics of the cars during the day(oops, thankfully I also took some with my iPhone so it wasn't a total waste), my pics came out awesome. I purchased the 55-250mm IS lens and used that as my primary lens. I even got good pics of the Fireworks overlooking the ocean.I'm still learning my camera and photography in general but I would recommend this camera to anyone looking to get into DSLR cameras.

Reviews.Title: Big Purchase
Reviews.Author: Sarah Houseman
Reviews.Content: I had saved up for this camera for years, finally bit the bullet and bought it. I am in love!

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware - Qualifying lense rebate flakey
Reviews.Author: A. Kelley "Game Guru"
Reviews.Content: Strictly bought this to and a qualifying lense (B0011NVMO8 to save $150 off the price, and the camera was a great deal at the time.After 60 days of waiting (the rebate takes "60 days to process by vendor") I never saw the money. I've been back and forth with Amazon about the rebate, who have "no record of this deal" and now I'm out $150 because I can't return it.I like the camera, my first very bad experience with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Another great Canon DSLR body
Reviews.Author: G T KNIGHT
Reviews.Content: I already owned a Canon 40D and two Canon zoom lens with image stabilization-solid hardware from Canon. I wanted a second body but wanted a lighter and less expensive model. The T4i was the perfect choice for me. It has almost everything the T5i has and it is about $100.00 less. Very good value. My T4i worked perfectly right out of the box. I have used it with two of my Canon lenses-one zoom and the EF40 pancake lens. It works smoothly with fairly quiet shutter noise. It is easy to operate-the controls are somewhat intuitive and very easy to learn. One of the best qualities is how light the T4i is-compared to a pro type like my 40 D. I know, the T4i is a plastic body vs metal. I'm not a bit concerned about the durability of this body. It is well made like all Canon cameras. I will probably carry this camera with me more often because of its reduced size and weight. I have large hands and the body feels fine in my grip-a little small, but ergonomically OK in my hands. The reduced weight is a pleasure to use and carry. I love the articulating screen on the back and like the fact that it takes HD videos. I bought a 16 gigabyte high speed SD card for a main memory card. The processor in the camera is lightning fast-much faster than my 40 D. Very good value camera body. Plenty good enough as a second or third body for a Pro, and perfect for the advanced amateur or beginner. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Second DSLR, amazing.
Reviews.Author: Mattk
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a nikon d5000. It just came in the mail, it did come a day late, i ordered ovenight shipping and it came in 2 days but it still came very quickly and it works amazing. the battery makes a high pitched whine while charging up. but the camera is great and comes with a strap, cables, battery and cover, lens, and covers, body, and cover,and instructions, and charger. very good camera. you could be a novice and this camera would make your photos look great.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR camera.
Reviews.Author: WTW
Reviews.Content: Not know how to compare. Feel good and meet my expectation. The 18-135mmSTM lense is excellent to me. The pictures are  very sharp for the wide angle.

Reviews.Title: My son loves it!
Reviews.Author: Shiree
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift. My son finished a year of photography and just loves this camera. He took a picture outside, AT NIGHT, and it came out clear as day! He also took some incredible pictures of lightning! I must say, it is too confusing for me to use but if you are looking for a good digital SLR with good video capabilities, this is a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: This Camera will inspire you!
Reviews.Author: Jfitz
Reviews.Content: Even if you're not a professional, anyone can take great pictures with this camera.  The touchscreen is very user friendly and this camera is designed to make you want to try different modes. From black and white to hd video it does it all. I absolutely love this camera and recommend it to anyone. Much better than the Nikons I've had it the past. If your ready to dig into serious photography, this is your best bet!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfactory
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Dickson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our daughter and her husband so I'm not really qualified to review it in depth as I am not the user.  However, I do know that they are very happy with it.  The lens covers a good range that is useful for probably 80-90% of situations.

Reviews.Title: CANON EOS REBEL T4i
Reviews.Author: April3232
Reviews.Content: So in love with my new camera. it is the best and it has got me on top of the world. I am taking photography classes and it is coming in handy for what I am needing.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures without much experience
Reviews.Author: Nils Werner
Reviews.Content: This camera is my first semi-professional one and does a great job. The handling is easy and the different functions are quickly learned. I took it with me on a few trips already and was surprised that the camera didn't bother me much. Not too heavy or anything.But for great pictures on wide and close angles you should spend the extra dollars and get both lenses.

Reviews.Title: Its a awesome camera, I love it.
Reviews.Author: satish pasula
Reviews.Content: I used to use normal digital camera and after buying this I realized why didn't I buy a SLR all these days.As its really cool and awesome. We went on a trip to Colorado and the pictures were amazing

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR and loving it
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, light weight and takes amazing pictures.  Haven't tried every setting yet but I love it.

Reviews.Title: Canon T4i
Reviews.Author: chicobrewer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice upgrade from my T2i canon. I enjoy using the camera, except when shooting active wildlife movies, the LCD screen doesn't work very well its to hard to follow the movement. View through the lens would be a significant improvement over the current option.

Reviews.Title: BEST BANG FOR THE BUCK!!!
Reviews.Author: JDExtraZ
Reviews.Content: This camera is so simple and is just as easy as a point and click camera.  You dont have to go into all the settings to take a great picture.  Just wait until you are more comfortable with the camera.  I love it and highly recommend it.  I almost went with the Nikon 5200.  Glad I didn't.  Just dont skimp when you get different lenses.  You spend the money on a great lens, it only enhances this camera.  This is just my opinion.  I would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: Nickolas G. Pizzalato "Nickolas P."
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 5 hours and taken so many pictures and video. I upgraded from the Canon Reble XTi and this is so great. My other Canon was great but glad i made the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: love it! :)
Reviews.Author: Andrea G.
Reviews.Content: thanks. the item works and im already testing all the manual functions.  hopefully i ll be buying another one next year :)

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Alex Warren
Reviews.Content: From an amateur's perspective, this camera has way more features than I could ever hope to use.  But the nice part about it is that it will grow with me.  It is simple to learn.  Videos online about it are thoroughly amazing.  CameraRecToby has done an excellent series of videos on this.  A friend of mine owns a T3i and finds that it is very similar except for a few minor changes.  I'm happy to get the newer one, but if you think you are going to have to sacrifice another $100 for the upgrade, I wouldn't do it.  But I love my camera.  Having way to much fun with it.

Reviews.Title: Same camera as the t5i for significantly less $
Reviews.Author: B. Upton
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera after 6months of research...it's a great camera for beginners (me) at least. Touch screen sounds silly, but is a great addition.Canon is stopping production of these to force you to buy the t5i for more money. Buy it now!!!

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera.
Reviews.Author: Nina Hayes
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade from my Rebel T3. Very pleased with the Canon Rebel t4i. Great clarity of my photos, easy to use. Went out the weekend after I got my camera on a photo adventure. Battery lasted the whole trip. No problems with the camera. Order delivered as promised and packaged well to protect the contents of the box.

Reviews.Title: Canon 4Ti
Reviews.Author: Lrod125
Reviews.Content: The camera meets all of my expectations, I had to upgrade the lens to an STM 55-135 IS zoom lens because the one it came with was crappy. Overall,,it's an expectional camera that does the job.

Reviews.Title: Love at First Shutter Release
Reviews.Author: Robin Spielberg "Spobs Music"
Reviews.Content: EASY TO USE!!! My husband uses the manual settings and puts his photography degree to use. I use the automatic setting and look like a pro. Win-win.

Reviews.Title: Camera that's built for beginners or pros
Reviews.Author: Behdad Sassani "Gwoodzdisciple"
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete novice when it comes to photography but let me tell you this camera will get you going with the automatic setting till you start actually learning to do manual photos. I would recommend to get the for dummies for this camera because it's a great way to learn how to shoot various shots in different situations. Also the 1080p recording is great, especially when I used it for SXSW in Austin this year, all my shows were recorded nice and crisp.

Reviews.Title: Best value for your money
Reviews.Author: Sandamal Weerasinghe
Reviews.Content: Awesome product, I regret nothing!!The lens is much better than the 18-55mm and for this price it is worth it.If you're considering a 700D (T5i) DON'T!! buy this.

Reviews.Title: I Just Love it
Reviews.Author: Willie Jackson "LoveToWin"
Reviews.Content: Not being a rich person as myself, I don't think you can beat this camera for the price. I was amazed how well it takes pictures from almost no light to sunlight. It is also very fast and with all the features this camera has to offer, I just can't imagine anyone that wouldn't be very happy with buying one.

Reviews.Title: Dream camera!
Reviews.Author: Pamela Van Etten
Reviews.Content: This is such a wonderful camera. My "grands" look so awesome in the pictures. I am very inexperienced with any type of camera except a point and shoot and took this out of the box, put on the lens and off I went out into the yard to figure it out. Surprisingly the pictures turned out great. I've been reading the instruction book and it's very user friendly. I look forward to many "great" pictures with this fine instrument!  I can't offer expert advice but for a novice it has been great....happy snapping!

Reviews.Title: Holy Cow buy this now
Reviews.Author: Ken Farrar
Reviews.Content: Have a yard sale, apply for credit, donate plasma.  If you have kids don't waste your time with anything less than this.  It is by far the best camera I have ever owned.  I have had tons of the point and shoots, high zooms and phones with cameras (which I don't really even count, but had to mention since I see so many parents using apples to document graduations???)  My kids have been in sports for years and I have been spending money on progressively more expensive cameras for 16 years.  I finally decided to buy this since my kids are getting into high school and I'm running out of time to find an inexpensive camera that will take pics of them in motion.So far I have used this to take about 1,000 pics.  It is amazing.  The dial on the top allows you to select many generic settings that will make all the adjustments for you and give you reasonable pics.  I say reasonable like I'm a pro, not the case.  I'm an leaning as I go with this.  Once you get the hang of that you can switch to more advanced settings.  I have played with this some and they are easy to change and do change back when going back to the auto modes.  (thank goodness for that)Compared to other cameras in its class I cannot say how it measures up.  All I know is Nikon and Canon are the best.  I compared features for months before deciding to go with this one.  It came in just under my budget and had the features I was looking for.  Plus the price dropped upon the announcement of the T5i.  The T5i has better Video I think.The 5 frames a second is spectacular.  I have taken photos of my son at base ball games and it freezes the ball to the point where you can see the colors of the letters and stitching on the ball.  I think if I get better at the focus you will be able to read the lettering.  But I'm zoomed in with the stock lens so this may affect shutter speed.I also purchased a 75-300mm lens and it is impressive.  I went the cheap route and did not get the motion reduction one.  I do not see that taking pictures in good lighting that I will need it, or I can just prop it up on a tripod.I cannot express how much I "enjoy" taking photos now over it being a chore with point and shoot cameras.  This is what photography should be.  The Canon T4i makes taking photos easy and although I am new to these type of cameras I feel like a pro and my pictures are turning out like I want them to for the first time.Of all my electronic purchases including TV's, tuners, keyboards, etc, etc this is the one item I can honestly say I am most proud of.As a side note:  If you keep a couple different lenses in your bag, you will have people asking if you can take their kids senior pics, prom date photos, blah blah blah.  I may take up a few offers to off set the payments of this thing.  But could not be happier with money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy Novice
Reviews.Author: Jonathan D. Phares "J P Allenmonkey"
Reviews.Content: I've only ever owned point and shoot cameras, and I have always been unhappy with the quality of my photos. Thinking of what I spent on all the cameras I was unhappy with, I could have bought the T4i twice. I'm glad I finally made the right decision. This camera takes beautiful, sharp pictures with no effort or skill on my part. I immediately became interested in macro photography, so now I'm messing around with that. And, quality pictures of my two toddlers are filling up my cloud storage. Time for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Best camera so far!!!!
Reviews.Author: taslim mohammed
Reviews.Content: This is my first professional camera... This camera is easy to use and takes great picture... over all 9 out of 10.....

Reviews.Title: Great first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Philip B. Senerchia
Reviews.Content: Frustrated with a not-cheap point and shoot, I finally bought a "real" camera, and love it. Fantastic first DSLR; very easy to use and intuitive without knowing much, and tons of opportunity to grow. LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: All is great with latest Cannon Rebel!
Reviews.Author: Gabby
Reviews.Content: Great! Great! Great! Great for a growing amateur photographer looking to have their camera match and go beyond their advancing technic and style! Its just as amazing for a professional as well! Highly recommend for anyone looking to get better and produce high quality photos!

Reviews.Title: Great pictues and new auto focus STM lense super quiet in video mode .
Reviews.Author: Robert Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: Great camera and touch display very user friendly. Get the STM lens!!The Sandisk Extreme SD transfers data quickly. Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Well engineered and user-friendly
Reviews.Author: SKRX
Reviews.Content: I bought the T4i after a lot of research. I had an advanced point-and-shoot previously, and had pretty much pushed it to its limit. The logical choice was to move to an entry-level DSLR. I have been thrilled with the T4i so far. The articulating touchscreen is great, and the menus are very user friendly. The quality is very impressive for the price. It feels absolutely solid and durable. I've learned a lot about advanced photography since buying the T4i, but I see no foreseeable need to upgrade to a more expensive camera. It does everything I want for a very reasonable price. I would highly recommend investing in a model-specific reference book instead of relying on the owner's manual. I bought "Canon EOS Rebel T4i For Dummies" and it really helped me get the most out of the camera. You will not be disappointed with this camera unless you are expecting a $3000 camera for $700.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: David Scott
Reviews.Content: My old camera was the original Canon Digital Rebel. The advancements that have been made on Canon's consumer level camera's are phenomenal. The T4i has much of the functionality of a Prosumer Camera and exceeds the functionality that many Pro Cameras had just a few years back.The articulating view screen on the back scares me a little when extended out from the camera body, but it's a great feature that is worth the risk and extra care needed to not break it. For all I know, it is quite sturdy but the mounting swivel is pretty small and fragile looking.The 18-135 kit lens is better quality than many kit lenses I have seen in the past. It's not a pro lens, but it doesn't "feel" cheap and the picture quality I have been getting is quite good. The camera has happily accepted all of the lenses I used with my old Rebel and my old Elan IIe 35mm camera.If you are due for an upgrade from an older DSLR, go for it! I couldn't be happier with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera.
Reviews.Author: David Rivas
Reviews.Content: I love the T4i, I am a beginner to the photo world and video world and let me say the T4i is a great starter camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera.The touch screen is amazing and the picture quality is beautiful.I am only a beginner but I was able to take pictures right away.

Reviews.Title: Goog improvement over T3i
Reviews.Author: StuartM
Reviews.Content: Low light multi shot works really well - HDR does not appear to be effective and does not work at all in direct view (non viewfinder) mode

Reviews.Title: Glad I studied up on lenses and got this combo.
Reviews.Author: M. Schoenfeld
Reviews.Content: My last camera was a c. 2005 point-and-shoot. I was ready for the "big girl" DSLR. I knew nothing about lenses. I had no idea why I'd want an 18~135mm lens, other than I take a lot of action photos, and don't have time to get closer to my subject.I am so glad I got the T4i with this lens! If you know nothing about interchangeable lenses, let me tell you -- a wide angle lens doesn't mean your subject will be tiny. The zoom capability takes care of that. You can get the equivalent of a 5x zoom with this lens. If you need more than that, get another lens or crop. Yes, just crop in Photoshop.LOVE: Image Stabilization, baby cakes! How many times have I ruined a shot due to hand shake? A thing of the past. It's built into the lens, though you can turn it off for artistic effects.ALSO LOVE: Shutter priority! Aperture priority! A real treat after the nearly-always-auto point-and-shoot. I'm learning a lot about exposure and the ways to get challenging shots and artistic shots.One last word: HDR. That stands for high dynamic range. Does it right in the camera. For the shots where there is a lot of light behind your subject, and you'd like to capture some of the detail in the lighter areas. Be ready to use a tripod for that, but also be aware of the artistic possibilities of a long exposure with HDR that gives you those artistic streaks, such as moving water or city scenes.I'm having a lot of fun with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Better then the T1i rebel, an awesome upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I would defiantly recommend this camera to anyone looking to upgrade an old one. I have always loved canon and this is the reason why! Very nice touch screen, great pictures, great video. Amazing camera all the way around!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Boniface "Stay@home Dad"
Reviews.Content: Fast shooting speed in RAW (which I mostly use) and I love the touch screen and its ability to pull out and turn/flip.  This purchase was an upgrade from my T2i and I love the fact that all my accessories (battery grip/battery/remote shutter switches/lenses) all work with the T4i.  The pictures are much less grainy when blown up versus the T2i, thanks to the Digic 5 processor/sensor.  I highly recommend this camera...the only drawback seems to be a small pause when changing shooting modes on the touchscreen (it gives you a short informational screen telling you what the mode is used for).  A slight annoyance for those of us that already know.  ***The T4i I ordered is a post-recall version, so no worries about the rubber grips.***

Reviews.Title: Great camera, hard to take a bad picture
Reviews.Author: MikeZJ
Reviews.Content: The camera is great combined with my Tamron 18-270 IS lens (not many limits).  The touchscreen makes moving around in the custom settings a breeze and is a great interface for reviewing your pictures as well.  It zooms and scrolls like my Smartphone.  The new sensor and processor have also raised the quality of my pictures and video greatly.  The color saturation, contrast and resolution are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it is very sharp, the auto focus for this lens is fast and it's nice and quiet. The only thing I'm not sure about is the video. But I haven't taken the time yet to read the manual yet! The video isn't why I bought the camera though, so I think the camera and lens are great. : )

Reviews.Title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
Reviews.Author: Green Monster
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, and all my friends with their T3is are very envious. The instant focus in video mode is fantastic, and love the touch screen. Definitely get the 18-135mm lens or better if you only purchase the body. Don't go with the smaller lens unless maybe you will never do anything other than portraits in a studio.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Lijie Lin
Reviews.Content: I own this camera for two weeks now, and I love it so far. Been taking pics outdoors and in museums. The quality of the pictures taken by this camera is just great. I also love the feel of this camera. However, I'm new to DSLR cameras. SO I have so much to learn about photography.

Reviews.Title: First and best camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: Michael Morgan
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first camera to shoot film and shoot pictures for class and for personal use. This camera has become my new best friend i take it everywhere so i don't miss a thing. I would highly suggest getting this version because it comes with the 18-35mm lens which is a sure treasure! Since I've ordered this camera I've been ordering new equipment for it and I'm shooting projects! Pair it with CS6 and your in business! Wonderful buy great price and fantastic camera!!!! If you need some handy tips search the camera name in youtube there are some very handy shooting tips online.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Lane
Reviews.Content: I looked at several different products and after speaking with several folks about it, this one was right up my alley.  If you want a camera that's a lot better than a pocket camera, but you don't want to pay the price for a professional camera, this is for you.  I suggest buying a nice lens for the camera as well.

Reviews.Title: Camara
Reviews.Author: Jorge Chavarini
Reviews.Content: Espectacular cámara profesional. Super completa, muy fiel. Saca fotos de excelente calidad. No hay nada para anotar negativo. REcomendable por supuesto

Reviews.Title: Too late for old dogs?
Reviews.Author: Snowbird
Reviews.Content: The challenge for this amateur is to take the time to read and re-read the manual and field guide so that the major features can be put to use by instinct instead of constant reference to printed matter. At age eighty, I'm not sure I have that much time but i"m going to give it my best effort.  I expect to enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! I had originally planned to purchase the Canon Rebel T3i, but after years of saving and watching the price drop, when I went to purchase it, the T4i was only $50 more. I am a noob, but was able to pull this camera straight from the box, charge the battery, insert the SD card and start snapping beautiful pics - without ever touching the manual. I purchased this with the 55-250 IS lens and have taken my first pic of the moon that actually looks like the moon (not a small blob of light in the distance). I could not be happier! It was worth the wait and, though I usually do not splurge on high priced items for myself, I have no regrets! In only 1 week of owning this I already have so many wonderful family and scenic pics of a quality I have never seen outside professional photography.

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Peace Ndon
Reviews.Content: I'm just now getting into being more serious with my videos for YouTube and taking pictures and this camera does it perfect . ! Love it

Reviews.Title: Swept me off my feet
Reviews.Author: CYBORGX "CYBORGX"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebels have never disapointed me. The intelligent scene detection is awesome. The camera does virtually everything for you. The touchscreen is a big plus. The particular lense on this one is crazy good.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: SanJose Geek
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner in photography, I find this camera easy to use. Especially if you want to take HD movies.The STM lens kit is awesome. I have an old EOS 10Q, and the lens can be used on this Crop frame body. Cool!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a first DSLR/Video recorder.
Reviews.Author: Terry May
Reviews.Content: My first notion was to modernize my video camera but to get the modern equivalent to my HF10 I needed to go with a G10 costing $1050-1200 plus tax. With the T4i I get a lot more flexibility especially with lenses. With the T4i/STM 18-135mm system I get great AF without the internal noise and super video in low-light. For my purposes of video inside a church, low-light functionality is the most important aspect. Now I am also getting far better photos, too. I saved a couple of hundred bucks and got more functionality but also more size and weight. A trade off I am willing to make. I have a lot to learn with so many more settings but I am putting in the study time. The one thing I didn't take into my considerations is the ability to run the camera off of wall electricity and that is a bother. But it is a very rare condition for video so extensive I need that - I can use the HF10 for that which still is a great camcorder, just dated with a lack in some of its functions.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful, easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: L. Linnell "Hay Lady"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research when I was ready to purchase a DSLR camers and I have had the Canon brand for 30+ years so I wanted to stick with Canon.  The Rebel T4i is an amazing camera and so very easy to use.  I am learning the ins and outs of its opperation and have volumes to learn about all of its functions but have not been at all disappointed with any pictures I have taken.  The colors and textures it brings out are amazing!  This is a camera I will enthusiastically recommend to anyone who wants to take their photography up another level without having to spend the BIG bucks!

Reviews.Title: I am so excited about this purchase
Reviews.Author: Robert Beeman
Reviews.Content: I just received this kit about a week ago, and I have carried it everywhere I go since. This is my first DSLR experience, and I'm hooked. I've only had point and shoots before this (lots of them). The image quality and lens options change everything. I definitely recommend the 18-135MM STM kit lens option over the other two for this purchase.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: I was needing to upgrade from a [fairly good] point-shoot camera. So when this camera was on sale, I decided to pull the trigger, and have been very happy with it. One of the advantages of this camera over cheap[er] point and shoots is the speed. Maybe more expensive cameras are faster, but I can shoot as soon as I can turn it on and get it to my eye. (I don't use the Live view setting much at all, except to take video.)The video capability is very nice. Again, my first Full HD device, so I REALLY like it, and it works for me very well. Very likely other cameras/camcorders do better, but I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing DSLR
Reviews.Author: Robert Caputo "Bob"
Reviews.Content: The Canon EOS Rebel T4i is an amazing DSLR. The specs are great, as are the images. The images are crisp, clear and sharp and very large (18 MP) -- overall, everything looks great. The touch screen works great, as does the entire camera. I like the layout of the buttons and the quick settings button -- and the touchscreen and dedicated keys/control pad makes everything even better!Do I recommend this camera -- YES!Amazing camera, amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ben Abraham
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from T2i.  Slightly heavier and bigger but you don't realize it over time.  Touch screen really is iphone-esque.  18-135 lens is great too.  Definitely worth it

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Hot Pink "Nicole"
Reviews.Content: This is such a nice camera. I love the touch screen. It helps a novice know what each setting is without the manual too. It can do it all with video too. It's super easy to use And takes awesome pictures! So glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Michael Edwards
Reviews.Content: I started my research on which video camera to get 4-5 weeks before Christmas and decided on a Video Camera, once I received it I decided the quality was not what I wanted. I have been seeing for months on youtube many videos which were created by DSLR's. Note: I was trained in Videography when I was in college and although not working in that field any longer I still appreciate great quality video. So I decided to try a DSLR and with all my research I found that Canon Makes some of the Best DSLR's for Video especially the 5D III. Since I couldn't really afford the 5D I decided to try the T4i. What a great decision. This camera shoots great Video and great photos. You will like the quality of the video and if you've ever shot professional video you'll like the Manual features.Also these days there are multiple companies that make accessories specifically for DSLR Video that you'll love. Most of which you can find on Amazon. You probably want to check out some Blogs and Youtube videos on how to shoot with DSLR's because it is different than your typical consumer video camera.Warning... if you expect to have exactly the same features as Consumer video cameras this is not the product for you. It does have similar features like Auto Focus and image stabilization (stabilization is great)  but the Auto Focus is no near as good as a consumer video cameras. You can hear the lens trying to focus in all the audio. Don't get me wrong it is good you just need to be aware of the extra noise in the background of the lens moving to correct focus. This is what I expected going in and I like to have more control of my cameras so this is a great camera for me. And for the price you can't beat it.Lastly you'll want to get a good Prime lens, something like a telephoto 50mm (I purchased the Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 II Camera Lens) A great lens for the price. Again this was expected and really another reason to get a DSLR, the ability to change out lens is great and again you can get everything you need at Amazon.All in all this has been a great purchase and of course Amazon is great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: E. A. Bujak "bbujak"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. It will take some time to master all the features - but my worst picture on this camera so far is still better than my best on any other camera I have.I cannot complain at all about this camera and am pleased as punch that I chose this camera over the others I looked at. I would definately buy this again. Purchased with the 18-135mm lens.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera EOS Rebel T4i.
Reviews.Author: Estela Robles
Reviews.Content: I just bought my camera a month ago and I  have already taken beautifull photos, specially of my original paintings.This camera is magic. I am still studying the many features of it in the book I bought "For dummies".

Reviews.Title: I REGRET NOTHING
Reviews.Author: nezimon
Reviews.Content: At the time i bought the T4i was going for $842.81 refurbished. Now you can purchase one for $200 less! but I REGRET NOTHING! I have used it many times since its arrival in November. The flip out, touch screen is an added plus and makes filming a breeze. Instead of bending, squatting or contorting my body in any way the the flip out screen cuts that out.If you have the money like I did and are wondering whether to buy this specific canon or any other canons you should really look up Dave Dugdale and his hands on review on the T4i and the Canon 60D. His video review helped me out a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera from what I can tell so far.
Reviews.Author: jrampey
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality photos and very easy to use. My wife absolutely loves this camera. Will look to get some new lenses at some point.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: gophsvikes
Reviews.Content: Takes excellent photos.  My first D-SLR.  The camera modes are very forgiving, makes it very hard to take a bad picture.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Whois1145
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to upgrade from my Canon XSI.  HD video blew my mind.  I got the USM lens and it's so quite.  Clear pictures.  Win-Win.  For some strange reason even tho I have a super fast card it seems to write slower than my XSI.  Maybe i'm imaging things, maybe not?

Reviews.Title: lots to learn
Reviews.Author: adele
Reviews.Content: I have been quite pleased with my purchase. All I can say though is that I have a lot of learning to do. There are so many option that maybe I should have purchased a camera with not so many options but I think once I have it figured out I will love it.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my NEW CANON REBEL!
Reviews.Author: jim lee
Reviews.Content: The seller name's Echozoe has done what she said she will do and that is MOST important to me....her words and integrity which build trust between us worked out great!  I suggested to here to use USPM to reduced the shipping cost and she did plus she even paid the extra charge  w/o charging me.I received the Canon Rebel T4i today in perfect condition and it's working great.  I LOVE THIS camera!  Thank you so much Echoezoe and if I see your name again on the seller list, I will choose u first among the other sellers.Have a great day,Jim Lee

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: blackhorse
Reviews.Content: I have used this camara for two months now. And I have take a lot of wonderful pictures. I have to say that it is a really good companion for me. btw, the rotating touch screen is very useful when you want to take a picture of yourself.

Reviews.Title: Great camera,  great deal
Reviews.Author: HT
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a beginner with such a great deal. I have a few weeks playing with it and so far I have no complain. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Can't say enough!
Reviews.Author: MsBarlow
Reviews.Content: This camera was the hit of the year for my husband! He cannot stop taking photos with this sophisticated yet easy to use camera. The pictures are outstanding and we are delighted!

Reviews.Title: A decent camera
Reviews.Author: Zhibin Zhou
Reviews.Content: It is a decent, entry-level camera. It's image quality is close the professional DSLR cameras we got. We used this camera mainly for baby shooting and it performs extremely well in the lighting room setting with low ISO.

Reviews.Title: Suberb Camera - Well advanced compared to Rebels of the past and even the 60D
Reviews.Author: Yechwando
Reviews.Content: Superb Camera for the price. Build quality is solid, but a bit plastic-feeling compared to 5D and 1D (of course). The touch screen is a huge upgrade in terms of usability vs. 60D and T3i. I would not consider those camera for a similar price any more.  This may be a Rebel, but it is still an advanced camera requiring good quality lenses. It fares well with the 100mm macro IS L, and the sensor uses the lens to its fullest capability. One caution with this camera. Non-Canon flashes and studio strobes do not work in live view mode. This camera is a blast to use. Another word of advice, coming from a 5D and 1D, I think this camera requires a grip. I hate small bodies. But if you like small bodies, you'll love it.Yatinchachadphotography.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: peterbee
Reviews.Content: My last 'real' camera still takes film (old Rebel from around 1995). Since then I'd always used the higher end point and shoot Canon cameras. I have wanted a Digital SLR for quite some time, but always kept putting it off.Finally made the plunge, and I can't believe the quality of pictures that this camera produces. I'm extremely happy with it, and the STM kit lens that came with it.If you are on the fence, seriously just do it it's amazing.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera...!!!
Reviews.Author: manthan
Reviews.Content: a great upgrade by Canon and about look, its look same as T3i and T2i.. Great That t4i does not disappoint me in Image quality.

Reviews.Title: nice....
Reviews.Author: GMMHEIL
Reviews.Content: I'm being partial, because I just love this camera. couldn't find anything bad on it,I also shot some video, and plugged an external mic (wireless), and the sound quality surprised me, considering that it is not a "video camera"I'm happy happy happy!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: Jon Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Rebel T4i a few weeks ago. It easily surpassed my expectations. The picture quality is exceptional, it is very easy it use and has a myriad of features, including shooting videos (which are at very high quality). Ultimately, I believe this is the best camera under $2000 (The Canon EOS 5D will then take the crown). This is simply one of the best cameras on the market and the better quality only improves with the quality of the lens you purchase. At this price, it is a steal.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: MaxW
Reviews.Content: Like the most people already wrote, this camera is just perfect. As an exchange student, i wanted to make the best possible photos for my family, friends and memory! This camera helps me still allot. I like it and the touchscreen is one of the best things on this camera. Just tip, where you want your focus point and baam, the camera makes it for you. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: fran abramson
Reviews.Content: So much camera packed into a smaller body compared to the 60 EOS.  Love it.  So many features. Nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: Simply Great!!!
Reviews.Author: honeylover456
Reviews.Content: No words to describe...simply superb. The exterior quality is good and of course the clarity is just amazing..Did a lot of research on T3i too but T4i had good exterior build and great features..Glad I bought this..

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!  Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: V. Anders
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera as a replacement for a Digital non-SLR.  We spent a long time trying out various Digital SLRs (months). Narrowed it down to the T4i and the T3i and decided to spend a little extra and go for the T4i.  We are very glad we did.  Have not been disappointed with this camera in the least .  Pictures have been great even in low light.  Natural color every time.  The auto flash is very powerful.  Focus has been spot on every time.  Even though we didn't buy it for this reason the touch screen has been very handy.Make sure and go with the 18-135mm STM lens as opposed to the bundles with two lenses.  It is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Went from a canon 3ti to a 4ti....
Reviews.Author: dawn joy
Reviews.Content: It seems like when I take a big group picture the people on the way right are alittle out of focus.. but that happened with my other canon 3ti.  not for sure what is up with that.  I like the 18 to 135 lens....  I take alot of sports pictures, basketball right now, and they seem to be sharp.  I am waiting for some developed ones to see how  they are.  I am still learning on some of the new features.  So far, I am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Vito R Giannone
Reviews.Content: awesome Camera! Very user friendly esp. for first time DSLR buyers like myself. The t4i feels very grippy and the touch screen monitor is very cool, pictures are very clear and crisp if you follow the tutorials . All in all I love this camera for my first DSLR ,not regretting one bit the money spent to upgrade from the "point and shoots " I've had used all my adult life.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Janet Burns
Reviews.Content: I am a newbie DSLR user. Camera does so much that I haven't figured out yet, but the pictures I have taken I think are pretty awesome. I mostly have taken action shots; horses moving very quickly and people from far away. The pictures are so clear I can see the smallest detail of the dirt flying, hair blowing, and facial expressions.

Reviews.Title: Love it! One of the best and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Liptak "lip89"
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a point and shoot Canon Elphi to this camera and I couldnt be happier. I am not a camera person at all but this is so easy to use and takes the sharpest and clearest pictures I have ever seen. Crisp and with autofocus this is better than a point and shoot. I gave the point and shoot away and who cares about the bulkier camera since it takes better shots? I researched cameras for weeks and was going back and forth between Nikon and Canon but you can never go wrong with a Canon. Nikon has it's faults and is not a easy to use. Also this is a better model than the T3i. You won't go wrong, buy this now!

Reviews.Title: Canon T4i is great
Reviews.Author: D. Danielson
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera to shoot my son's football, baseball and my daughters swim events.  It works great with the IS II 55mm lens.  I have an old 300mm that focuses a bit too slowly for it when using the fast shots, but I'll take care of that at Christmas :-)  I'm enjoying it and I haven't used a 300 for some time -- it was easy to pick up again.

Reviews.Title: My Copy Had Major Issues
Reviews.Author: Know What I Mean?  Nudge Nudge "NH AV Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by stating that I love Canon cameras.  I own several of their point and shoots and several of their DSLRs including the T1i, T3i, 20D, and 60D.  All have preformed very well.  The T4i is a different story.  It is very similar in function to the T3i and 60D.  Unfortunately, either the camera or the STM 18-135mm lens has issues.I shot approximately 300 images while I had the camera, and I was continually let down by the softness of the pictures.  I'm shot in different modes, at focal lengths, and made numerous adjustments to the settings.  The softness was still there.  Let me be clear-the softness was visible even when viewing the pics in Lightroom, without pixel peeping.  When I did zoom, it was very evident something was not right.To compare, I shot the same subjects at the same time with  myT1i, T3i, and 60D.  All were significantly sharper, and interestingly had better color accuracy than the T4i. I also shot the same subjects with my Nikon P5000, which is not known for its great sharpness.  Even the Nikon trumped the T4i!I called Canon, who as always were very helpful.  The walked me through  a few things I hadn't tried, but the issue remained.  I want to give Canon major kudos here for having a call center in the USA!  What a novel idea.  Than you Canon.So ultimately I decided to return my T4i.  I've since done some research on this and found that there are numerous other mentions of the softness issue that I had with this camera.I still love Canon, but the body/lens combination has some QC issues.  Fortunately Amazon has a great return policy.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Y00P3R
Reviews.Content: As a first time DSLR owner I was a bit nervous that I would not be able to take good pictures or video. Boy was I wrong. This camera makes everything so easy for the user in auto mode. Even when I switched over to manual the onscreen info helped greatly in setting the camera to take wicked awesome pictures. I am very thrilled with the choice I made in making this my first DSLR. I highly recommend! A+++

Reviews.Title: Best first DSLR!
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Thakur
Reviews.Content: I am a part-time photography enthusiast who had an added need for a fast and good indoors camera to capture my 1 yr old toddler at home. I have a 'vintage' Canon S5 IS but it's more of an outdoor camera.I couldn't be happier with my T4i which I got along with the 18-135 STM lens. My assessment, after my own usage and reading a lot of stuff and reviews online, is that this camera is an excellent package.1. Speed and responsiveness- Being my first DSLR, it appears incredibly fast. Further research showed that Canon has indeed jacked up its numbers. T4i is faster than previous rebels in terms of shutter lag and is now closer to 60D (which still remains comfortably ahead).2. Low light performance- Another reason people opt for a DSLR is getting good low light performance. T4i doesn't disappoint. ISO 3200 is quite alright and if needed, ISO 6400 can also be used. At 12800 it starts looking like a P&S; camera working overtime. Nikon D5100 apparently has better ISO performance, nearly one stop better which means its corresponding numbers are closer to 6400 and 12800- but T4i has a trick up its sleeve- multi shot noise reduction! However, it requires a tripod.3. User friendliness- There is no beating T4i here. The touch screen is superb- so good that the camera starts encroaching 60D's boundaries in terms of functionality and efficiency. No more forgetting that white balance needs to be changed and quick change of , say, ISO from 200 to 3200. You see it; you do it- that's it! And yes, the touch to click feature- it's a gimmick but a good one at that!4. Video- Video on DSLRs has been a big hit and it's easy to see why. The video quality of T4i is superb and autofocus quite good, at least on STM lens. It's still not good enough for capturing fast action but very good for relatively 'low energy' videos. Especially with a dedicated video button, capturing videos in a pinch becomes much, much easier.5. Remote flash control- Sure, I have not used it but it ensures I will have something to look forward to in terms of advancing my photography skills even after a couple of years. It's not available on D5100.The T4i is a more significant upgrade from T3i (faster autofocus, faster processor in DIGIC5, touch screen, 5fps continuous shooting, chromatic aberration correction option (from 60D), stereo microphones and useful modes in Handheld Night Scene, Multishot Noise Reduction and in-camera HDR (better than D5100, again!)) than T3i was from T2i (swivel screen, external flash control and creative filters). Upgrading when you already have a previous model is a matter of debate but as a first DSLR there shouldn't be any doubt about which one calls the shots! In fact, T4i is so good that Canon had better come up with 70D to protect that line of cameras!The only sore point is the price. I got a good deal around Christmas but in general, D5100 is much cheaper. The body-only version is nearly $150 cheaper around these days!

Reviews.Title: Canon T4i / 650D review
Reviews.Author: Michael Keeter
Reviews.Content: About 6 years ago I started slowly getting into photography. About 3 years ago I majorly got into it, and since then I've played around with and completely figured out several other people's DLSR cameras. Mainly the Canon XSi, T3i, and 60D. The T4i is the first one I've personally owned, and weather you are completely new or a pro this is a great camera once you learn to use it.The auto modes semi-auto modes can take awesome pictures with hardly any camera knowledge at all. The manual mode and semi-auto modes can easily be used by pros to take great quality photos.  If you know how to use the camera correctly you can shoot photos in any type of light setting.  I shoot in near to pitch black darkness sometimes with great results.If you are into just snapping photos of whatever you might come across I'd suggest picking up several different IS lenses for different distances. Unlike most of today's point and shoot cameras DSLRs can't zoom from in front of your face to the moon with one lens. If you are into different types of photography I'd highly suggest picking up a few different lens hoods, a flash & diffuser, wireless remote, tripod, and a battery grip with extra batteries as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a beginner
Reviews.Author: Bavaria
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera and so far I love it. I have no real experience with photography but I was able to come up with some pretty nice pictures already. The presesets like "Automatic", "Portrait", "NightShot"... yield really good results for a newbie. The camera itself feels sturdy and has a good feel to it when holding it. The weight is good as well even when carrying it around for an hour or more. All the buttons are nicely arranged and coming to this from using a Canon Powershoot before I felt right at home.Only negative so far is the video function. I read in reviews that you really need one of the new and more expensive STM lenses for autofocus in video mode and they were right. I don't have a STM lense but I would say video with the regular EF lense is almost not feasable. On the other side I bought this for taking pictures and not for shooting movies.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Cost
Reviews.Author: Dorminyk
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a Rebel XSi. What a difference. It could be me, but the clarity of the images is just astounding. The rotating display is awesome when you need to get above people in crowds or the like. I've done this a few times... The touch screen is also implemented rather well. Feels natural to use. The Camera sensor is the same that's in the Canon 7D as well.Pro's: Light weight camera body. Rotating screen. Touch screen, very intuitive. Takes excellent images. Stereo microphone's on the body. Ability to do audio adjustments within the cameraCon's: Video recording is limited to only 29m59s. This is not explained or even mentioned in the manual. Plastic body (It's rather tough though). STM Lens is heavy, twice the weight of the camera (or so it seams).All in all, great camera for the "prosumer" in all of us.Here are a few sample images that I have taken with this camera. [...]

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Juan Escamilla Castillo
Reviews.Content: The only complain i have is that batteries and grips for the previous Rebel T1i  are not compatible with this camera. If one wants to look your videos or pictures on a TV screen you must buy a HDMI cable (not included). Instead lenses, remote control RC1 and Opteka XL Remote Release Cord for Canon EOS Digital Rebel XT, XTi, XSi, XS, T1i, & Canon Powershot G10 Digtial SLR Cameras (10 Foot Cord) ~ work fine. The creative filter's effects can only be applied to pictures taken with your EOS Rebel T4i.

Reviews.Title: You will not be disappointed.
Reviews.Author: JUST SAYING
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  It takes great photos and great video.  The autofocus on the video is a bit sensitive so you have to select the item that you want to focus on or it will try to focus continually on a moving object.  I don't see that as a negative, I see that as having total control over the focus without doing everything manually.  The 18-135 lens is a must.  I never feel like I need another lens.  This is my first foray into DSLRs and Canon has made this an awesome experience.  Although I was nervous about spending this amount for a camera, I've found that it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Andrew Metcalf "The truth."
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to play with a demonstration model of this camera, and it seems to have a small learning curve for the AF feature, but it works flawlessly. There are two things about the 60D that are allegedly better. The viewfinder uses a pentaprism as opposed to a fixed mirror. 99% of people would never know the difference, and I don't think its any better even knowing the difference. The construction of the 60D body is slightly more durable, but Canon recommends not dropping either one. Other than that, the T4i is superior in every other way. It is also likely that the T4i is the replacement for the 60D as well as the T3i, and the pending 6D is the replacement for the 7D, with a near $2000 price tag.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Entry Level DSLR - Few Glitches
Reviews.Author: swarn
Reviews.Content: I moved to T4i from T2i. I have used T2i for more than 2 years, pleased with its performance and recently sold it. Before moving to T4i, I tested D5100 and D3200. I did not like D5100 due to lack of external controls and poor battery life. Same for D3200 and high noise due to high mega pixels. So finally settled at T4i.After using this camera for a week, I returned it, that will be explained later in this review.Pros:+ It offers touch screen (very handy when setting focus on live view),+ It has HDR (does not produce the perfect blend of 3 shots, but good to have in built HDR rather than post processing).+ It has Hand Held Night Shot feature, which produces excellent output with very good details in low light, it takes 4 shots quickly in low light and then takes few seconds to produce the final image.+ STM Lens (18-135) works as mentioned by Canon, there is no noise while auto focusing in video mode. It seems STM lens has electronic focus ring as you can keep on rotating the focus ring and it does not have a stop, most probably it uses internal auto focus motor of T4i.Coins:- The camera frozen 2-3 times while using, I had to remove and re-insert the battery to get it working again.- Since focus ring does not have any stop while rotating, there is not acknowledgement that you reached the bottom or top of the focus limits, you just guess.Why I returned this camera:-- After a week of use the camera Frozen again in Auto Mode (While Using Internal Flash) and showed error 50 on screen, I removed the battery and re-inserted, it worked, but when I went to Auto Mode again using Internal Flash, it showed same error. It's loop of error which does not fix changing the settings.It may be an issue with this piece of camera only, looking at the good features, I am giving 4 stars to this Camera.Edit: 11/24/2012I ordered a replacement for same camera, if it works fine, I will change the rating to 5.Edit: 12/04Changing the rating to 5. The replacement unit does not have the problem that I faced on the previous one.

Reviews.Title: Improvements easily seen
Reviews.Author: robert ryan "robsphotos"
Reviews.Content: I think i've own every Canon Rebel except for the Canon T3i. There is a very noticeable difference in picture quality from t2i to t4i. Photos are more in focus and sharp. Low light shots come out beautiful. Only wish that the price was the same as when the t2i first came out. Also, whats with the multiple 18 megapixel cameras? Canon went from 8 to 10 to 12 to 15 to 18, then 18, then 18 again. t4i should be 21 by now

Reviews.Title: My Wife loves this camera
Reviews.Author: Taron Boyd
Reviews.Content: Best camera we have ever bought.  We rarely use a point and shoot since i bought this one for my wife.  So much fun and not too overwhelming for a amateur/beginner.  Buy an SD card that's fast and has a lot of storage.  These type of cameras need more room than any point shoot, and you will like the camera more if the SD card can write fast.  We have a 128 GB with 45 MB per second.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its price!!!
Reviews.Author: F. Campos "Neomasochist"
Reviews.Content: Things i like about this camera:it takes beautiful shots, always leaving vivid colors.automatic white balance usually gets the job done, but there is also manual w/byou can manually focus or do it automatically with a button switch.the kit comes with 18-55 lens kit which is fine, but you can always change itit is lightweight.has a Digic 5 sensor, so it's like buying a 60D but a lot cheaper.Video quality is beautiful, with 24fps it gives you that "film look" college people crave.If you are on a budget but need a good camera fast, this one is the one.Things i dislike and you should consider:the lens tends to focus in central spots and other areas can be blurred.  ex. i took a picture of myrabbit and the camera focused on her nose but the rest of her face was slightly blurry.You need to get a class 6 or higher sd memory card to record videos or the camera will record short clips and stop.The auto focus motor is a tad bit loud but not too loud.  the upside to this is that with the noise you can tell if the camerais focusing for you or not.I recommend a remote control or external shutter button if you want to take sharp night shots because holding it with your handscan still create slight motion blur.The lens kit of 18-55 is a good starter but it is not the best for shooting small insects and objects because it starts to blur when you zoom in all the way.  I guess the lens only recognizes larger objects like people.  A bigger lens like 55-250 mm lens would be a great investment to be used with this camera once you get the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: 6 weeks later
Reviews.Author: DonutAvenger
Reviews.Content: 6 weeks ago, I purchased this camera from Amazon. Since then, it has served me well.Pros:When shooting nature/landscape photography, colors are vibrant and images sharp. When shooting action shots using the sports mode, the camera shoots crisp images, and it really does keep going at 5.0 FPS. Finally, the Creative Auto mode makes settings like background blur very very easy to control.Cons:When shooting using the screen instead of the viewfinder, the camera focuses a lot slower than usual, and the max FPS is a lot lower. This is annoying if you really need to get into hard-to-reach places, but shouldnt affect you otherwise.Final Words:You really should purchase this lens kit over the 18-55mm if you do not have another lens handy. An 18-55 lens really doesnt give you any practical zoom at all, unlike this lens which gives a decent amount of zoom, enough for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Rob Hunter
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Pay the extra for the 18-135mm lens instead of the 18-55.  Pay attention to the offer details as these can bite you, but I do love it.

Reviews.Title: great beginners camera
Reviews.Author: Maleko "islndsnw"
Reviews.Content: Got this after contemplating a full frame like 6d.  For a beginner though you can't beat the features and 18mp is plenty for learning.  First of all for about 2k,  you can get various lenses in the EF variety and a cheap speedlite.  I have a 1.4 50mm, 18-135 came with camera. 75-300 and speedlite 320.  Bought cheap fotodiox lens hoods and gotta say for a budget setup, I'm taking some great photos.  Getting some great bokeh shots and the clarity/blur is awesome.  Even having fun in lower light settings with my 1.4 50mm lens and getting some great shots.  What I like is I can set it to some of the built in modes at first and see what the camera sets.  Then I play with aperture or iso to further enhance the shot.  Hand held night shots can be tricky but if you have a tripod or can brace the camera, it'll shoot 3 shots and blend the pics to make a nice rich night view.  Great touch screen and having fun with my speedlite, like learning to bounce flash in different directions and remotely for awesome effects.  There's lot to learn in good photography and you don't need 5k to do it.  Haven't tried the video mode yet, but just another plus for the camera.  The only con i have is that its not weather sealed like its more expensive siblings.  Get the full frame body once you learn, I'll be looking at a full frame in a couple of years and my EF lens investment won't be wasted.

Reviews.Title: great camera to learn from
Reviews.Author: JPX925
Reviews.Content: I am not a photography expert or techie so my review is only based on what I have experienced with this camera. I wavered between the T3i and the T4i. I was hesitant about the T4i's touchscreen as it may be slow or that my fingers might be big for the touchscreen 'buttons' and I didn't want to be aggravated by having to struggle with it. Also, because T4i has features that are new, I was thinking that there might be glitches about these features or more product recalls, etc. The T3i, on the other hand, had been on the market longer and has had more reviews written about it from actual consumers. I said either I'll keep the T3i or wait for a T5i or a T6i. BUT, one thing that made me want to try the T4i anyway is that my T3i is made in Taiwan and the T4i, from what I've known, is made in Japan (this is an important detail to me). So I returned the T3i (from another website) and ordered the T4i with the 18-135mm IS STM lens kit. I am very pleased that I made the switch. First, the touchscreen is impressively responsive and precise, and the touchscreen shuts off automatically if anything is held in front of it or if it's facing against your chest while hung around your neck (saves battery life). The auto focus is so fast, it is practically 'instant'. I love the STM lens because I actually use this to videotape my dogs. I actually ordered it with the 55-250mm IS and a 18-55mm IS lenses that I will use for other purposes. I plan to learn as much as I can about this camera's features, and maybe photography too. I am dying to get one of the 'pancake' STM lenses but will have to learn more first with what I currently have at hand.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Dennis Long
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera for Christmas and after taking a few shots of the Christmas Eve festivities all I can say is "Wow!". The 18 megapixel feature makes all the difference in picture quality. It takes a while to become familiar with all the features, however, if you use the automatic mode the camera does the rest and it in essence becomes point and shoot, and you will be delighted. With practice and experience and adding lenses and remotes you will be able to perform magic with this camera. I have been taking pictures for 65 years starting with a box camera, but have never seen such great technology.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from XTi
Reviews.Author: Ben Kurtz
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great upgrade from the Rebel Xti I had previously.  The wide ISO range and automatic settings really improves photos in lower light situations.  The 5 fps capture rate is super for catching my kids sports activities.  So far I'm really happy with the camera.  Only gave four stars because I haven't had an opportunity to try more stuff with it.

Reviews.Title: Canon T4i
Reviews.Author: J. Santana
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR camera and I am glad I purchased it.  I have been taking pictures for about a month now and I a very pleased.  I need to upgrade lens but other than that I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: In love with this camera
Reviews.Author: Cassi M. Walker
Reviews.Content: I got a second hand Nikon for a photography class since I didn't have $900 to drop on a camera for a 3 credit college class.  But after that camera went into electronic malfunction while I was working on my final project, I had to rent this Canon Rebel T4i from my school's media center and I don't think I can ever pick up another camera other than this again.  It is amazing.  Obviously I'm still somewhat of an amateur, but this camera is so user friendly and the picture quality was so much better than my Nikon.  This will absolutely be the next camera I buy!

Reviews.Title: Camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Baba Shlinka
Reviews.Content: Camera is amazing but the only problem I have is the charger and the missing HDMI cord.The charger worked on day 1. It's been over a week of owning this and it's time for a recharge... What do you know... The charger is doesn't work all of a sudden and now I can't use my awesome camera. Also where is the HDMI cord that was supposed to come with this? Regardless, the time I had with the T4i has been beautiful. It really is a wonderful camera and I'm glad I didn't get the recalled version!

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Ranee
Reviews.Content: I like my camera.  I just need to play with it a lot more then I do.  I love the black & white pictures I have taken with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Jrister24
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love this camera! It is simple enough that an armature can use but has enough features that a semi-professional can use.
