I am a freelance NASCAR photojournalist and this is the camera I use. I've also taken some great photos of my family as well as some night shots of the moon.I highly recommend getting this package with the 18-135 mm lens over the 18-55 mm lens. This is a better lens and gives you a better range of zoom. For most people, you'll never need another lens if you get this package.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: vdiz
Reviews.Content: Came on time and the product is in beautiful condition. I've yet to use it yet, but I purchased it for my photobooth project and I know it'll be wonderful!!Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: D. HUEY
Reviews.Content: Though there is an upgrade this first iteration of the new Canon model is perfect for a novice and an intermediate.Fast and easy. I just transitioned to a DSLR and am not regretting the move.The touchscreen is cool, the MP is more than sufficient, and most important, the photos look great.Please make sure to pair this with a external flash and your shots will look semi-pro.These new T series/Rebels are great.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this Camera
Reviews.Author: Maureen E. Profera "jitterbug"
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from an EOS 40D.  I am so happy with all the little extra's this camera offers along with the easy to use flip out screen.  Anyone can use the manual mode successfully without having to use a guide book.  They make it so simple!  Plus I can record a video.  I just purchased an expensive microphone so there is no need to bring a video camera for special occasions.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: T. Davies
Reviews.Content: So many features  packed into a small package.  Simple to use for the novice but has lot's of advanced tools as well.  Shoots great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing machine!!!!!
Reviews.Author: THighter
Reviews.Content: I love the canon t4i! the flip out screen and extra features really bring it to life, this is a great entry-level dslr!! good quality! superb results

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Salman
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR purchase and without a doubt i couldn't be happier with my purchase.Everything about this camera from the ease of the touch screen to the quality of the pictures is great amazing to me. Ive never been familiar with DSLR's although this camera made me want to learn everything there is to know about generating an amazing picture. Im an avid photographer, no where near professional but this camera make me feel as though i am. If anyone is looking for an entry level DSLR to play around with and have a couple extra dollars to spend without a doubt i would recommend this camera to you.I did purchase the camera with the 18-55 mm lens which i though was great although didnt zoom in enough for me so i went ahead and purchased the Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM (which i do wish i did before hand, would have saved me 200 dollars), this lens is amazing and almost no noise when focusing. I would say if your going to get the T4i purchase the Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM lens set, you would be much more happy with your purchase and the camera will last you a very long time.

Reviews.Title: So easy to learn!
Reviews.Author: Amanda T "Krimson And Clover"
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a good camera for a few years, and finally decided to splurge. It was well worth it! I was worried it might be too complicated, but that isn't the case at all!I love how there are automatic settings, but also adjustable ones too. I can get a little creative, but if I'm in a hurry, I can just use the automatic settings for some decent photos.The manual that came with it is SUPER helpful. Not a totally dry read like manuals usually are. It was full of really great tips and tricks too.This camera is now my baby that I take everywhere with me!

Reviews.Title: For Starters
Reviews.Author: Tara Emick
Reviews.Content: Haven't even opened it yet because it is for my wife however, it arrived 2 days sooner than expected so I am giving 5/5 for the seller!!! Great job!!! We will be back to write more after we have had a chance to use it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera.
Reviews.Author: D Wright
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a year ago.  I don't know how I ever got along without it.  It is easy to use for basic pictures.  And if you want to experiment with your picture taking there are plenty of settings you can practice with.  Love the fact that I can see the picture now and erase it if it is not the shot I was trying to capture.  The touch screen is awesome too.  So many pluses, I can't begin to list them all!  Cannon did a great job producing a great camera at an affordable price.  I just wish I had more time to use it.

Reviews.Title: Best thing ever.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Winter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over a year ago and it is awesome. Anyone looking to start a new hobby or upgrade your camera, I recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Perfect relation price/quality
Reviews.Author: ricardo lama mangiola
Reviews.Content: This is a entry level camera but it will fill your expectations. And the lens is really great. Perfect for travelling if you don't want to me changing lenses.

Reviews.Title: Beginner, but very pleased
Reviews.Author: J. McG.
Reviews.Content: I have only begun to really use my camera all the time. Sometimes with new gadgets, I'm a little finicky about getting them out and using them like they are designed to be used. But the more comfortable I've become with other people using it, I've taken it to more events.Overall, the camera takes really nice photos. The autofocus works pretty quickly, even at full zoom, and the camera has a number of different settings for different types of photos. It's an obvious step up from point and shoot cameras and your phone. I haven't invested in any other lenses yet and only use the kit lens that was included in my purchase. I love the touch screen and like the overall weight of the camera. I don't have anything negative to report yet, but will change my review if I do.

Reviews.Title: Great lens, Never have to change lenses
Reviews.Author: David Burkhart
Reviews.Content: I am getting so pampered by never having to change lenses. I'm sure a situation will come up when I'll have to swap it out for my prime or my long-range zoom. But, for now, I am loving it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Alessandro F.
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, takes excellent pictures (though you can take very good pictures with other cameras too, you just need to set them right).Perfect for me being a hobby photographer. The sensor is very good and it's and upgrade in the Rebel line of cameras. Has very high ISO and a lot of new features that the old Rebels did not have.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: B. Nikolic
Reviews.Content: Very good and easy to handle camera. Default lens is not that good as expected, but with better quality lenses makes really good pictures. Video is excellent, and I'm wonder how could I live without rotating display before!

Reviews.Title: Happy With My First DSLR Camera!
Reviews.Author: Half Pint
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 10 months ago. I had no idea how to use a DSLR at all. I cannot claim to have much knowledge of these cameras, but I am very happy with my purchase. I am still learning how to take photos with my camera, but the pictures come out beautifully when I take a good photo! I like the flip screen in the back and the menu navigation. It is a fun entry-level DSLR camera. I purchased quite a bit of gear for my new camera which have been great buys for a beginner trying to save some money yet collect a few accessories! This SD card B0037FLUYU this battery B006Y0YZZ6 this camera bag B0045O0DHW this remote B0058SPE8C screen protector B008BURQNK this lens filter Vivitar UV 67 67mm Ultraviolet Filter this lens hood Fotodiox Dedicated Bayonet 18 135mm Replaces and this zoom lens Canon 55 250mm 4 0 5 6 Telephoto Digital I still have a lot more to learn and practice but I am happy with my Canon Rebel T4i. I mainly take photos of my toddler and family, special events, vacations, and when I have free time I take scenic and any other photos I can! :)

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: R. Reese
Reviews.Content: I researched for months.  i cifered for months.  i was going to buy the Tsi3, and changed my mind at the last.  I am so glad i did.  This camera is great.  I am sure the TSi3 would have been great too, but i love the touch screen feature TSI4 gives.  I love taking photo's and I am not a professional by no means.  This camera helps me to take great photo's with out the professional wisdom.  i do plan on readingup on the TSI4 help book i plan to buy to learn more about what all this baby can do. i am excited about learning on this camera.  I am very satisfied with my purchase. i have had this camera about 9 months now.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T4i with 18-135 EF-S Stm
Reviews.Author: JRad
Reviews.Content: Love it! A super camera that performs beautifully. Battery lasts for a month or more even with average use. Recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: A great performing camera for beginners.
Reviews.Author: M. West
Reviews.Content: Great build. Feel really good in hands. I am sure others have covered the many technical specs of this camera so I won't re-interate. The one thing I will say is I love the articulating LCD. It allows for framing shots at difficult angles like over head or low to the ground. I only wish the camera had built-in wifi but there is always the Canon 60D for that. The T5i has since replaced this camera which provided very small improvements. Either camera is worth it so go with the best price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Turner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last year for my school. I am in a Visual communications program and have used this camera for a couple of my photography classes. It is easy to use and takes great photographs. i like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Zeke
Reviews.Content: Love this camera with all the features. Great starter camera. Touch screen is amazing. Takes great pictures. Wide choice of lenses..

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: DAVIS93
Reviews.Content: I love this Camera. I have used this Camera for Weddings, Birthday's, Anniversary's, Church, and so much more, and had really Great Pictures. And I love the Software that comes with it. Really Would Recommend this Camera for Beginner's and Professionals.

Reviews.Title: You will enjoy using this camera.
Reviews.Author: gozreh
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It took a little time to get used to all the settings but was worth learning. I really enjoy taking pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: BUY SMART
Reviews.Author: Bill McLean "Is this worth the price?"
Reviews.Content: This T4i has some features that are important advances over my 'T2i.  The articulating screen is one for which I will have very seldom any use.  But when  I need it, it will be of very great importance -  I will get the shoot.  The increased  shots per second  is a feature for which I will have a lot more use - i'm primarily an action shooter.  After several months, I have had no use at all for  touch screen camera control.  Maybe someday . . .My choice as most useful lens is not one of my Canon lenses.  I choose the Sigma 50-200 mm, f1:4-5.6,  USM, It is quite sharp, focuses very fast, and has always given me the best results at the dog park.  But I do have other lenses for other purposes - Canon lenses and others.  I would rather use my Sigma 18 - 250 mm lens than my 18 - 55 mm Canon kit lens.  It's sharper throughout its range and I have it now on my T2i.  I have not always bought smart.  May you make better choices.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but focus takes a while and flash doesn't comply sometimes.
Reviews.Author: cameron duncan
Reviews.Content: Takes beautiful pictures but takes a while to focus. But wow the pictures it takes are great, however, you can miss out on opportunities due to focus time. Also sometimes when I want the flash it doesn't pop up it has a mind of its own.

Reviews.Title: am little piece of heaven
Reviews.Author: Luis Arévalo
Reviews.Content: Heaven.... i'm in heaven. I've used it for quite some months now, and i'm still in love. it handles ISO just perfectly, going as far as 800 ISO and the photos look like a charm

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: this is being used by our publicity people to take pictures for use in our printed and digital media to let people know what we are doing.

Reviews.Title: So many great capabilities for the price - wish I had replaced my old camera sooner.
Reviews.Author: PanaMark
Reviews.Content: This was a refurbished model and I have found absolutely no flaw with it - so given this experience I would not hesitate to buy refurbished again.  I had had a previous SLR stolen and did a lot of research replacing it.  I am astounded at what a few years' new technology has produced, especially at this price point. This camera has features and capabilities that I am just beginning to experiment with, but so far I am very pleased.  The picture quality and auto-focus are excellent, the number of shots I can get per second is wonderful - I am having the best results now with moving subjects!  I used the low-light handheld night feature and found the camera sucked in so much light that my "black" silhouettes suddenly had colors!  And great sharp outlines.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image quality, great battery life, stock lens is versatile
Reviews.Author: Alvin sng "Software Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first DSLR camera and I am loving it. I have previously owned several Canon Powershot cameras and I've always been a fan of Canon products. I also own a Canon HV20 Camcorder as well.Although I am not a professional photographer, I been able to produce a lot of great photos without much trouble. Learning the camera functionality is pretty easy and Canon has built the user interface it be seamless to switch between camera modes and the settings with ease. My friends are often impressed by the photos I have taken with this camera.The battery life on this camera is great. I could usually take over 1,000 photos or so before running low. I also purchased replacement batteries as well for my longer vacation trips. The stock lens are also well built. I have not purchased and additional lens and I find this to be enough. The wide angle at 18mm is excellent for both indoor and outdoor photos. The 55mm zoom is great for most use cases but If you find yourself always taking distance shots, you will likely need something beyond 55mm. The Camera takes really fast shots in continuous mode and is great when you want to get those jumping shots.The design of the camera is very high quality. It feels very expensive and the grip is nice. It is easy to hold steady and the viewfinder is clear. The image quality on the LCD is also super nice and the touchscreen feature is a super plus.Overall, I find myself enjoying this camera a lot. Although it is bigger than a point and shoot, the image quality is definitely noticeable compared to Powershots and smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am a serious non-pro photographer, and this camera is just what I needed for shooting pictures of my dogs, dog sports, and our various adventures.I don't like the video capabilities at all, but it might be user error. I tried the video a couple times and couldn't get it to record anything worth watching, so I gave up and pretty much never use it.The live view screen makes the camera search back and forth and back and forth for focus. I pretty much never use it, because even if it does find focus, it isn't on what I want it to focus on. I prefer just using the normal viewfinder and being able to choose my focus point and focus the camera myself.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bambs
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera especially for the wanna be professional.  You can learn how to take nice professional looking pics even though you really are just a stay at home mom!  And if you do not want to bother using all the features...there is always the option to set it on auto and just let the camera do its own thing.  Still get good pictures.

Reviews.Title: this is the camera of the year for starters
Reviews.Author: Srinivas Jonnalagadda
Reviews.Content: Love it love it, works great, awesomely awesome photos, maybe a little tough to find the correct settings however, as i am mostly on the default settings it does not hamper my needs

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent pictures, touchscreen really easy to use
Reviews.Author: Crindee
Reviews.Content: This is indubitably one of the best camera purchases I have ever made.  I've been through a lot of point-and-shoot cameras and decided to splurge on a nice DSLR, and I'm really happy that this is the one I chose.  It's user-friendly and takes high-quality pictures; what more could you ask for?  If you're starting to enter the realm of DSLR cameras, this is definitely a good start!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and my 1st DSLR
Reviews.Author: Kamelle Jaye
Reviews.Content: I've used the Nikon 3100, Nikon 3200, and the Canon t3i, but this one takes the cake. It has a great ergonomic feel to it with grips in strategic places. The auto focus is phenomenal but as you grow to use it, you should probably move towards manual settings. The Manual settings are easy to see, use, and understand. I have grown to like the the touch screen LCD and it makes altering settings very easy and quick. For photographers this is great, but as for people who make videos like me, I would definitely recommend an external mic. The in-camera mic pics up everything, literally. It shoots really nice 1080 video, yet I haven't messed with the slow motion part of it yet. Lastly, the buttons feel smooth and solid. Compared with Nikon, I felt that I didn't have to hit the buttons as hard, which eased my nerves. Overall great camera, for a great price, especially if you ant to get into the DSLR world

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Received product as per description, would recommend to everyone! fast trackable shipping... Looked everwhere for this item so I was pleased that they had it available. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: C. Raynor
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a new camera and did hours and hours of research and tried to see what camera would be the best for my needs. I am a videographer and only had a budget of about $1500.00 for a camera, mic and ect. I can say I have been very happy with this camera and its features. The recording quality is amazing. It also take great photos even with the kit lens. That is the one thing I am going to change now that I have some experience under my belt, the higher end lenses make a huge difference.I have shot weddings and engagements, nature, and use it in my business. I compared it with Nikon a lot which a lot of my friends use, at the end of the day I like the profile of the photos on the cannon better. It also helps that I have a old 35 MM Cannon  that is over 25 years old and still shoots photos like it did when it was new, so the quality of the camera is a critical issue for reliability. I love the performance of this camera and what it offers in a base model. Cannon is still doing an amazing job after all these years, it has further resolved my satisfaction with our 35 MM so my next one will be a high end full body Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all round.
Reviews.Author: Safdar Mustafa
Reviews.Content: My first DSLR after a lot of research and no regrets. Recommended it to many friends. I think what did it for me was swapping out the kit lens which are usually rubbish for the 18-135mm STM. STM part is important and worth investing in if you have time to read up on it. Also invested later in a 50mm 1.4 fixed lens which is great for portraits but don't use it that much TBH.

Reviews.Title: t4i great, ImageBrowser glitchful
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda
Reviews.Content: The camera is terrific.  My problem was the software.  ImageBrowser wouldn't install properly, kept coming up with error messages about Silverlight.  Troubleshooting software on the Canon CD WOULD NOT uninstall software.  We uninstalled by hand.  Finally reinstalled from my husband's CD (we bought cameras at about the same time).  Even then, after reinstall (hah!) ImageBrowser still would not load up.  In desperation, we downloaded Zoombrowser from the Canon website.  Took a little doing, but it loaded and opened easily.  And then, in downloading images from the memory card, ImageBrowser opened ....  Gack.  Horrible software.  No one at Canon appears to have any answer - message boards had multiple complaints about this, but no seemingly easy answer.  CANON!!!  Fix the software!  To you who want to buy the camera - it's terrific.  Great pics.  You'll learn to use it.  But download Zoombrowser from the Canon website until they actually fix ImageBrowser or buy Lightroom (Adobe).

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera! Watch tutorials and read the manuel!
Reviews.Author: Hannahh92
Reviews.Content: It's a GREAT middle cost DSLR. It does so many things. You just have to learn how to do them. This is a Professional camera and your pictures will turn out like crap if you don't understand shutter speed, ISO, and aperature. So make sure you learn these things before trying to take pics like a professional. And this is a good camera to learn on.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel T4i is Awesome.
Reviews.Author: JUD
Reviews.Content: Oh my I can't say enough good things about this camera. Its my pride and job. I know I will be upgrading at some time bur right now this is one awesome camera........You can't believe what you can do with this camera................

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: bs1978
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have waited long time for this camera and at last this is with me. I am enjoying taking picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: vito
Reviews.Content: My wife loves taking pictures. This camera has stepped up the quality level of her pictures.  So far, she just uses the automatic modes and it always works great.  I would suggest buying one of the larger lenses available.

Reviews.Title: Flash issue sticking...needs fixed!
Reviews.Author: d jenkins
Reviews.Content: overall great camera... the lens this comes with is not all that great! We had to buy a better lens ( $350.00) that included a rebate! Our problem is now just less than 6 months of ownership to a almost 700 dollar camera the flash lens wont open 95% of the time///which in turn wont let you take a picture! So this is a big issue that needs attention!

Reviews.Title: Loved the clarity
Reviews.Author: Vamshi Krishna
Reviews.Content: If you know/use the canon camera features you will LOVE IT. Just be careful while handling in the moist weather.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffery C Gibson
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, but this camera is easy to use, takes great pictures and makes it easy to play with functions and setting to get just the right picture

Reviews.Title: Rebel Camera
Reviews.Author: John R. Cunningham "Tuskidero"
Reviews.Content: It was exactly as expected priced economically, constructed well and met all expectation. I would definitely recommend and buy again.

Reviews.Title: My THIRD Canon Txi!!!
Reviews.Author: Evelyn A. Cummings
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon cameras, and have loved them since my first Rebel in 35mm film ages and ages ago.  I currently have a T2i and a T3i, and decided it was time to upgrade since I had a young friend who was taking her first digital photography class and needed a camera for it.  I sold her my T2i, which of course gave me an excellent excuse to get a new one!After reading tons and tons of reviews I opted for the T4i over the T5i since other than some video improvements, they are pretty much the same.  I don't use the video, only stills, so that didn't matter to me at all.Once again, I was really happy with the camera out of the box!  The improvements over the T3i were pretty evident, especially the faster fps speed.  I was all set to HATE the touch screen, I pretty much only use the viewfinder and just preview with the LCD, but was shooting the moon the other night and discovered that touch screen is PERFECT when it's dark and you can't see the buttons and dials!!!  Good improvement, I must admit!My main complaint with my Canons is that the colors seem off to me, I pretty much always have to fix them in processing.  But, there IS some improvement in this model and I didn't have to fix as many of the photos.The speed is amazing... I am mostly shooting running dogs and/or moving wildlife so I use the sport setting and keep my finger on the shutter and nothing beats these Canon cameras!  This model actually surprised me... it is sooo fast I had double shots of the dogs while they were still in the air when jumping!While working up the photos on the computer I was happy to find that I could tell the ones from the T4i because they overall, were MUCH crisper and brighter.  When I moved up to the T3i from the T2i, there was no difference in the actual photos from either camera.Buy this camera, you will LOVE it, especially if you put a nice Canon L lens on it!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent - Canon EOS paired with Tamron AF 17-50mm
Reviews.Author: T. Miller "Sixty"
Reviews.Content: Paired my t4i with with the Tamron AF 17-50mm and love it.  I've taken photos of the family for a little over 3 months and have not had any issues.  The touchscreen is also a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pictures, Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Jeff Switzer
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.I takes excellent pictures in a variety of conditions.  I'm a rank amateur and I've been very happy with the results.I thought the touch screen would be an unnecessary toy; an embellishment from smartphones.  I've found that instead it is a wonderful tool and would a a requirement on any future camera.  The integration between the screen and the buttons on the camera is seemly.  Use the screen, then use a direction button, then use the screen for the same function.  It all works together so well.The 18-135 mm lens kit is the one to get.  The 18-135 mm makes for an excellent walking around lens.I've loaned the camera to several people.  One used it for taking pictures for a high school newspaper, in a photography class, and for other activities around the school, and won praise for her pictures.  Her 10-year old sister took some excellent pictures around my house.  Everyone quickly adapts to the camera whether they use more advanced features or just point and shoot.Battery life with both the Canon batteries and clones seems to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mr. S
Reviews.Content: Love these canon cameras, i still remember my first canon ixus IV i bought, since then i always look for Canon cameras (i am not saying others are bad)

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Hiren Majithiya
Reviews.Content: It is very good crop frame camera for a beginner. It's ideal for birds and wildlife photography. Very easy to use, touch screen is awesome. Color reproduction is quite good compared to other cameras. Battery life is impressive. I charge once and it runs for a fortnight. I love to have this in my bag.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: James D Stone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an older digital Rebel to photograph my climb if Mt. Whitney. So far, that us the only thing I used this camera for, and I could not be more pleased with the results. The color rendering is fantastic and it did a spectacular job getting the exposure right for some tricky lighting situations.

Reviews.Title: This is a really nice addition to the Rebel Line
Reviews.Author: Martin Stevens "marty"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this primarily for still photography.  This camera will do all and more for the photography I do.  The video capability is a nice addition.  If you want true seamless HD you should consider a camera specifically for that.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Vladimir Sukalovic
Reviews.Content: After long online research, I decided to buy T4i. Main reason for the purchase was new Digic 5 image procesor.It is fast, and night multi-shoot is neat feature. Another fact is that with cheap adapter I can use old M42 lenses with it (pentacon 50mm f1.8 for example, or Yashinon 135 f2.8). I tried camera with stock lense, and quality of photos is amazing. Battery life is good. It is easy to use, both in automatic and full manual mode.I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures, but...
Reviews.Author: C. A. Snow
Reviews.Content: So, firstly, the camera takes fantastic pictures.  The lens is awesome and the camera has all the features you will need for taking great shots.  The weight is okay, but with the 18-135mm lens its a bit big.  Takes a normal SDHC card, so no problems with that.  The batteries are slow to charge, but they last quite a while.  The viewfinder is extremely high-resolution - definitely helpful when trying to get good shotsThe camera is relatively simple to us if you've owned a Canon, Olympus, or similar camera in the past.  The buttons are all straightforward.So, why 3 stars???I've had the camera for about 5 months now, and I just had to send it in to the the Canon Service Center because it suffered an "Error: 20", which means that has some unknown mechanical error.  The camera as never been dropped, gotten wet, and has spent most of it's life being gently handled, so the problem is disturbing.  Either way, the error made the camera completely useless.  I will update this review once I get it back, but needless to say this is INCREDIBLY inconvenient...  I'm just glad it didn't happen when I was on vacation!***edit:  I sent the camera off for repair, and it came back, free of charge after about two weeks.  The camera is working again - good thing it has a 1 year warranty.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Kain Snow
Reviews.Content: My husband got this camera for me for a birthday present just before our daughter was born this past spring.  We knew we would be shooting a lot of pictures of our new baby and wanted a good SLR.  I have family members with this camera as well as the T3i and knew it was a good one.  Now that our daughter is 4 mo old, I have a little more time to explore and play with it.  Starting to venture off of the automatic settings and having a great time.  You can still take amazing pictures with the automatic settings though and not have to worry about knowing a lot about cameras.  The stock lens that comes with this camera is very good and works great for taking pictures on vacation and family gatherings.  I also picked up a 50mm lens that I love.  Its super easy to switch out lenses and I like the 50mm for portraits and detail still life shots.  Overall, this is a great family camera and will do anything an average camera user would ever want to do.  I'm sure there are features on this camera that I will never even use, but its great to have more than you need. I would highly recommend this camera and the only down side is that its a bit bulky (no more so than any other SLR) and I do worry about it getting stolen when leaving it in the car or hotel when traveling.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: EricaLee
Reviews.Content: This may be because this is my first "real" camera, but I absolutely love it!  Not too complicated but enough settings to do what you want with it.  I recommend doing what I did and purchasing the body (with the small lens) and shopping around for a better quality zoom lens that what comes with most of the package deals.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Steven E.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to upgrade from my older Canon EOS. I am still learning to use this but have found it to be very operator friendly. Great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Ash "Yup"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Rebel XTi and am very happy. Pictures are sharp and video is crisp and easy to shoot. Decided on body only due to having several lenses already.So many features that I need to learn but completely useful out of the box with the quick exposure modes and the touchscreen is icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Franky
Reviews.Content: The touch screen makes this camera. I purchased this several months ago and questioned if the T4i was worth the extra money over the T3i at the time, because the only notable difference was the touch screen it seemed. I must say, as someone who has used both camera extensively, the touch screen actually makes a pretty huge difference. They have the same functions and do the same things, but the ease of use with the touch screen on the T4i makes it a much more painless experience. Other then that, the camera itself is great. Quality is a good and is a good start for anyone looking to get into a more pro-level styled camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes fantastic pictures
Reviews.Author: David A. Sifre
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife, who was shooting with an old canon elph that she swore by.  However, I shoot with a Nikon D300, and she came to appreciate the benefits of a DSLR and wanted one of her own.  I am by no means a professional photographer, so move along if you have read all of the other photography site reviews and understood them.This camera takes great people pictures. I find the skin tones to be spot on almost all of the time.  If things don't look right it is invariably the white balance that needs to be adjusted due to being in a room with compact florescent lights, and once the adjustment is made, the pictures look perfect.Even the flash takes great pictures, though I find that it is a pretty darned low light shooter as long as the subject is not moving too much.  The touch screen is a bit of a gimmick for me, and I often forget it has one.  However, for the iPhone junkies out there, it is definitely going to be a plus.The camera feels good in my hands and my wife likes the way it feels as well. But it is still a DSLR and it is still a lot bigger than the point and shoot, so there are plenty of occasions when this camera gets left behind, such as when she is traveling solo with the kids to the zoo.It shoots great on auto and the 18-135 lens seems to be quite versatile.I find the battery life pretty good, and purchased some non OEM (Wasabi) batteries for a backup which seem to work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but...
Reviews.Author: Nona Poehler
Reviews.Content: Does anyone else have issues with focusing? Not sure if it's the camer or the lense.  Other than that, love the touch features.

Reviews.Title: Everything an Amateur/Beginner could ask for
Reviews.Author: Jake M
Reviews.Content: I Am a beginner photography enthusiast and I have had this camera for about a year. I love it. It has all of the modes necessary if you do not want to mess with manual mode. Video on this camera is very competitive compared to more expensive DSLRs. The touch screen is very responsive and clear. Its a wonderful camera for the price. For any beginner. I have dropped this camera about 4 ft onto a carpet and it is fine. The camera Kind of gave my bag a rubber smell. Overall i LOVE it

Reviews.Title: This is exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: bamamom
Reviews.Content: I got this myself after reading all the more professional review. I am just a person, who loves to take some pictures of landscapes, sunsets and my boy's ballgames. And this on can do all that and I bet more. I just have to play with it ;) This is the perfect camera for me and my purposes. Sorry NO professional bla bla, because I have no clue about all this. It's just easy to work with and do awesome pictures, even poster sized.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: oluwasegun
Reviews.Content: my first dslr. easy to use and learning alot. got great pics from long exposures of waterfalls to Humming birds

Reviews.Title: T4i > T5i
Reviews.Author: Paul Seiler
Reviews.Content: Anyone on a budget comparing this T4i with the T5i should stop now and click 'Buy'This camera is preforming well on every front for me.When I found out the minuscule differences between this and the T5i, I went to my local camera shop and checked them out side by side. Now you can't seem to find them together anywhere (brand new anyway). I suppose Canon stopped making them because they don't want anyone realizing just how similar the two models actually are, so they're selling the T3i side by side with the T5i at your local Best Buy so customers will actually see a handful of changes between the models.I opted for this CHEAPER "older" version. Keep in mind, this line of cameras is a "consumer grade" APS-C (crop sensor) body that Canon is updating every year like it's a new phone (with the same 18mp count mind you). "Professional grade" full-frame sensor bodies only get upgrades every 3 or 4 years. This camera only went on sale June 15th, 2012. That was a mere 14 months ago from the time of this post.This camera is still very much fresh, capable and well worth the money. I use my T4i with a set of Aputure Trigmaster triggers, a Yongnuo YN-560 III flash (when needed), a Canon 24-105 f4 IS USM L for video, a Canon 17-40 f4 USM L and a Canon 50mm f1.8.

Reviews.Title: Good beginner DSLR for video
Reviews.Author: R. I. Tollefson
Reviews.Content: I got this for intermediate-level video work after trying out a loaner. It's probably not as good for someone who does video full-time but for occasional productions, it's great. I debated a long time whether to go up to the 5D Mark II or III but what sold me on the T4i  (beside the entry-level price) is the tilting screen--if you like to shoot a lot of weird/low angles and want to see what you're doing, it's a feature that comes in very handy. I loved that the lens that came in with this package is not the most basic one so the price was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Are You Thinking About Upgrading From A Much Earlier Rebel Model?
Reviews.Author: The Electroacoustic Metallurgist "Bill"
Reviews.Content: You're reading reviews about this camera so the chances are very good that you already know all of this camera's specs, and know the differences between this camera and Canon's Rebel T3i & T5i. So, the purpose of my very brief review is to simply let you know that my SLR camera prior to this one was Canon's Rebel XTi model. I purchased that camera in 2006 so I figured it was time for a newer model. Of course this camera is an improvement over the Rebel XTi, however, what I didn't expect is just how much Canon's Rebel line has improved. The Rebel T4i's functionality, low-light performance and overall picture quality compared to the Rebel XTi is simply astounding. An absolutely enormous improvement. So, if you were like me and have a much older Rebel model, do not hesitate to get this model or the T5i. You will be nothing short of stunned by the leaps and bounds in camera quality and picture quality the Rebel line has achieved.

Reviews.Title: Totally happy with this entry Cam
Reviews.Author: Alexis O.
Reviews.Content: The camera functions perfectly for what I need it. I'm just starting with digital dslrs and it brings all the features that I might need so far. The only thing I can regret is that the kit lens is not compfortable as the focusing ring is on the front. I would have purchased if possible the new version that comes with the t5i (which I think is practicly the same camera for extra money).Other disadvantage it has is the autofocus function in live view mode. It is not as good as adverticed.Other than that, the camera is perfect.Built quality is ok, feels sturdy and if you add a battery grip to it it feels definitively professional.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  It shoots decent photos on the automatic setting and allows for more creative shots on the manual settings.  It is a little heavy and pricey, but we bought it through Electronics Basket, which saved us some money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift to my son-in-law. And he got in love with it. Quality of the picture is good and it worth buying it if you are a photo geek.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade to T4i
Reviews.Author: Camman
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a T2i to a T4i...And I almost did but the T4i and was going to wait till the 70d came out, but for 600 less than the 70d.  Glad I got the T4i.  Went out the first day for a test... Great Camara.  I test a T5i I saw no Diff in them and the T4i is less money.  Canon did a good job on this one.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel t4i
Reviews.Author: SoCal
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping i ordered the Camera on a Saturday and had it home by Tuesday. The Camera is really Nice its an upgrade from regular non Digital Camera. I take pictures of nature and the outdoors, Desert, Mountains, Beach it works really nice and Canon has other lenses. I have the standard 18-55 which is ok for indoors, I will research other lenses for telephoto pictures maybe the 55-250 see how that works out.I'm no Camera expert but this serves my simple needs and its a nice upgrade to DSLR from what i had.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat Amazon price
Reviews.Author: Mark Halling
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before settling on this camera, definitely worth the better 18-135mm ef-s lens. It seemed to take a while to get here but that is probably more because of where we live, shipping is slower in general. I use this camera all the time and love it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera + lens combo
Reviews.Author: IT Chris
Reviews.Content: I love the 18-135mm EF-S IS STM lens for this camera. It is a great lens that is very versatile. For most of the amateur shooting I do, I can avoid having to change lenses, which is a big deal. The STM lens is also great for shooting video.

Reviews.Title: Camera loving
Reviews.Author: beatrice
Reviews.Content: I haven't even explored 1/4 of its potential and I'm in total awe of it. Good camera. Very user friendly for the inexperienced hobbyist photographer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product - well work the cost
Reviews.Author: Daniel Bell
Reviews.Content: I used older film based SLR years ago.  Lately it is camera phones and the point and shoot digital cameras.  Neither of them are satisfiy as they do not take instant pictures, are slow to operate and typically blur the image.  This does everything with only a few setting I played with.  Also the ability to take a piture in a dark place appears bright when displayed amazes me.  I am excited about this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Easy to use
Reviews.Author: alphabear
Reviews.Content: I bought this to supplement my Canon 5D.  I use the T4 with a short lens for portraits, etc.  The 5D is for use with the telephoto lens.  This way I don't have to switch lenses and risk dirt contamination.  The camera is very versatile and the learning process of its capabilities is enjoyable as well as making me a better photographer.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!!
Reviews.Author: OTinWisc
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a XTI and I can say it's like night and day!!  Love it and I look forward to getting more Canon lenses.

Reviews.Title: I like some of Canon's other DSLR's better.
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Lima
Reviews.Content: I like my Canon 40D much better for ease of operation.  Maybe when I use this more it will become more intuitive.  I don't like the display screen presentation but picture quality seems excellent.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard McKay
Reviews.Content: Replaced a Canon Rebel DSLR with this model. Full auto to full manual shots are available. Handheld night shots mode is a great feature as is the Subject Backlight mode. With clarity of 18 mp photos can be enlarged and cropped for extreme close ups. Super fast ISO and Shutter Speeds allow super stopping power and continuous shooting are great for sports. HD movies are easy to shoot and the quality is fantastic. Using an SDHC memory card with large capacity make shoot video easy. The main drawback is when shooting video with no audio occurring is the grinding of the auto focus is recorded and when panning the focus of the main subject is lost and takes a while to find itself. I have not yet discovered all it can do.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Hayri Murat Fertelli
Reviews.Content: I was using a T2i and I decided to upgrade it. I ma happy that I choose this one. It is really a good camera. adjustable and touchscreen is very useful!HDR and Sport modes are also great. U can find many useful and upgraded settings. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Messier
Reviews.Content: This is one great package.  It is a great combination of lens and body without any extras needed, except for memory and spare battries.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - loaded with features
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Keller
Reviews.Content: This is my fist DSLR.  At first I was debating between the T3i and T4i, but finally decided that the touch screen, the STM lens support, and the enhanced video capabilities were worth the step up.  The 18-135 lens is WAY better than the other 18-55/55-250 combo.  It has metal mounts (not plastic) and the image quality is noticeably better.  As a beginner, this camera has optional tips that help you know how to use some of the advanced features which was useful when starting out.  Because this camera is new, it has some features that even the most expensive top of the line Canon's don't have (not saying it is better by any means, but it does have some neat features).  I love this camera and I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: kal
Reviews.Content: Took sometime to get used to it.After that absolutely amazing product. Better than in T3i interms of video quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! My first SLR
Reviews.Author: Devin Bridgen
Reviews.Content: I hemmed and hawed for a while over this, and I'm so happy I went with the T4i. The camera has all the features I want, while keeping a relatively small body size. I like the touch screen, though I don't use it a ton. Mostly for reviewing photos I have already taken. Though it does make navigating menus easier.Also - I got the 18-135mm lens, as opposed to the normal 18-55, and love it! It is definitely worth the extra money. For an everyday lens, it's an extremely useful range. And it's fast and quite.

Reviews.Title: No Brainer
Reviews.Author: Yak Yak Face "Yak"
Reviews.Content: MADE IN JAPAN, LENS TO!Canon has made a foolproof camera, braines not needed. Fantastic low light shots, features too many to believe, manual operation, automatic flash, WOW!  Get one immediately ....

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: Ram Man
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for an EOS T1i and the improvements are well worth the price. I could have gone with the T5i but from professional reveiwers it didn't sound like it was worth the extra $200. Love the new 18 to 135 STM lens. Focus is quick and nearly silent. So silent it takes some getting used to. Heading to Alaska later this summer and can't wait to try it out on the road.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from the original 350xt that I had
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I understand now the complaints that others had about the 18-135mm EF-S IS STM lens still not being great for shooting video when the subject is moving around. The focus issues are true, but seriously...who cares.  The rest of the camera is great if you're upgrading from an older model like I was.  Touch screen is actually pretty useful and can make some operations much quicker and adjustable screen makes it easy to take shots above people's heads.  Bottom line, I was making a major upgrade so I waited for this camera to go on sale and have loved it.  If you're upgrading from the T3i, read the rest of the reviews that make a pretty good point that you're not going to get a lot of bang for the buck. Just my 2 Cents.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Beemer
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning how to use this camera, and this is my first DSLR camera. Love it. Although a couple of my friends own Nikon D5200 and 7000, but the picture quality taken from these 2 cameras are pretty identical.

Reviews.Title: really good.
Reviews.Author: Harpal Singh
Reviews.Content: I have not explored all the functions of t4i as of now. its just a week. But after using it for a week I found  ts features, image quality and user interface excellent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: J. T. Valverde
Reviews.Content: OMG I am just beginning to discover the awesomeness of this camera. The It is surprisingly lightweight for its size and complexity. My photo quality has increased a few notches already.  You can use the camera in auto mode but you get better pictures when you use the manual settings. Great quality, easy handling. My new favorite!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Noel Mulcahy
Reviews.Content: Bought this product used and couldn't even tell. I love the touch screen and it's video switch. The stereo mic sounds much better. The video focus face tracker is pretty neat as well

Reviews.Title: BEATIFUL
Reviews.Author: Daniel Gimenez
Reviews.Content: I still do not internalize with the product but noticeable good endings, excellent quality materials, excellent camera, first mark and many features and excellent quality in photography, I do not notice a lot of difference in performance with the new t5i ... excellent ...... camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS T41
Reviews.Author: Older budget traveler
Reviews.Content: I love it. But I am puzzled by the launching of of EOS T5i by Cannon in less than 1 year its launching (of T4i) without any significant improvements or new features!

Reviews.Title: Very easy
Reviews.Author: Al Brown
Reviews.Content: I'm a video and and photographic professional.  I need an "easy" camera for run and gun. With the right lenses this camera looks AMAZING! I was very apprehensive about the touch screen.  I didn't want an iPhone on my prosumer camera! However, the touch screen is very intuitive and I find myself using it most if the time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: James Hahn
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace and older Rebel that I had problems with. Tis is a very good camera. Easy to use and the image stabilizer is amazing. I especially like the ISO setting. All of the settings are touch screen. Very well done. I thought the price was reasonable. I bought it through Amamzon and saved probably 70.00 compared the the box stores. The video works very nice. You have to buy a faster card for the video. I have used Canon cameras for 40 years. This one is very nice. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A great upgrade
Reviews.Author: George F. Benedict
Reviews.Content: A substantial and welcome upgrade from an older Rebel XTi. Don't know that I will get a lot of use out of the HD video capability, but its nice to have should the occasion present itself.

Reviews.Title: Really great Camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Arrived in one day and I absolutely love it.  Great Camera, don't buy the bundle get just the camera and the 18-135mm lens and buy the other stuff individually and get higher quality accessories.Aaron

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any major problems with it...I love the touch screen function. Although, it can be a bit slow sometimes...

Reviews.Title: Perfect bridge between amateur and professional photographer
Reviews.Author: Cliff M.
Reviews.Content: Has all the features and then some in a DSLR at this price.  Bridges the gap between the amateur and professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: The camera works and at a high quality level.
Reviews.Author: Gary Streiner
Reviews.Content: I use mine for documenting the restoration of a building. It's so easy to go from still to motion and back 20 times a day. The auto focus is very quick and accurate. I tend to do manual exposure, I still like to control the look of the pic.  What else can I say it's a really good quality camera for a very affordable price. It's main problem is the screen in bright sun light. But that every screen not just this one. At least the screen is so adjustable you can find a spot that's worktable.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Dominique Pettway
Reviews.Content: I recommend to anyone looking to slightly upgrade or to have a second camera, the T4i is a perfect camera for anyone looking to get into Photography

Reviews.Title: I Love My Camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the Canon T4i it does everything I want it to. I really like the touch screen it only took a few seconds to figure out the new menu set up

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: David PIneda
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, its the best from all the cheap DSLR that I've used in the past. Totally recommend  it

Reviews.Title: Solid camera and lens
Reviews.Author: Kirk Brohman
Reviews.Content: After purchasing this camera and lens combo a couple of months ago, I've already taken thousands of usable photos.  The settings are intuitive and simple once you actually start using them and the 135mm optical zoom is really convenient.  My only gripe so far is that the autofocus during video lags behind motion, but perhaps I need to research more to see if I'm doing it wrong.  Overall, this is an amazing camera and lens at a great value.

Reviews.Author: cosmin
Reviews.Content: i have 2 complains about the product : the cover of batery it is a little bit lose and it dosent close perfectly , when you toutch it you can feel that it is movingthe batery charger  it making a strange noise , an electric buzz even without batery in rest  it is a superb camera

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Roland A Berard
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my wife as a gift. This is her first digital SLR so I wanted to get her something nice. Since almost the first time she used it the smaller point and shoot camera (coolpix) hasn't been used

Reviews.Title: My first
Reviews.Author: Jean S.
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera and I LOVE it.  It was very easy to learn to use.  We use it mostly for video

Reviews.Title: Canon T4i digital camera
Reviews.Author: Denny
Reviews.Content: This is a simple camera with lots of extras. Lens is perfect for what i'm doing with the camera. As a set Awesome price and package

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Diana S Jay
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price point. Have always been very happy with my Cannon products I highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Not just for the Beginers
Reviews.Author: Toma Reaves "Toma J Reaves"
Reviews.Content: Although I have not used the Canon t4i much, ( due to time) I have been happy with the results that I have gotten. To start, I love the how it tell you what the functions are for it reminded me of my old Kodak z712is. Any novice will appreciate this feature to help them along. 2nd, the noise level seems a lot more cleaner then my Canon t2i. at 800 and 1600 through some test shots. So that is a big improvement.Now, Another feature That is to die for, is the handheld night scene, I like shooting in the dark and this feature is fast and takes the image as you see it; to explain, I shoot using the P,TV,AV,M modes, now using these modes gives some control of how your image will look, with the exception of Mode M which gives you full control. The handheld  night mode you stay still and take the photo and it combines 3 photos together to get the image, the camera makes all the decisions if you are pressed for time I say use this mode for night photos, in addition, this mode only works in Jpeg not RAW.I like the switch turns, OFF, ON, then Video. when I brought my T2i the first I said was I was for an easier transition to video. Good job on this Canon.Lastly, I used my other lenses on this camera for a few minutes, more testing has to be done; I do notice that they are louder on this body. However the 18-135mm STM lens is fast and  quieter, the autofocus is decent, not the best but fair game. image quality is very good and this lens wide range leaves a window for some versatility.conclusion:This camera is not just for the newbie, mid range photo bugs and some pros would love the easy of the T4i. it a has a little something for everyone. So what are you waiting for? Go Buy It!!!!

Reviews.Title: My first, my love
Reviews.Author: Daniel Alejandro Nuñez Ortega
Reviews.Content: I was hesitating to buy my camera but i went for this entry level model to start and well i'm quite satisfy with it, i went to a concert to try it out and man! the outcome was awesome, besides the 18-135mm lens helped a lot!! camera deals well in low light exposure allowing to take great pictures! if you are canon fan, and want a new camera you should go for it, don't waste money for the t5i or t3i this is just a blend between the two i totally went for this model, could've bought t5i but red review first and t4i totally satisfies every need you need.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: JLS
Reviews.Content: Canon has done a wonderful job on this one. Excellent quality on the body and 18-135 mm STM lens. Lots of ways to customize and easy to navigate menu. Image quality is excellent as well. For those having issues with soft images, check page 130 on the camera manual and customize the sharpness setting for the creative scenes. You certainly can't do better in this price range. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: My Take
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for her Birthday and she loves it.  She is by no means a pro, but says it is easy to use and takes great pictures.  For the money and quality you are not gonna do much better anywhere.

Reviews.Title: This canon is excellent but dry battery a lot
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: This Canon is excellent but should handy in about flash calibration.The sharpness and color are excellentGeneral quality is greatThis lens is incredible (18-135)

Reviews.Title: Canon does it again.
Reviews.Author: Kenzmyth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a backup to my 5D Mk2. It has become my workhorse event still camera and B-roll video camera.The AF hunting is aggravating in video mode, so I use manual focus. Excellent image quality in both modes.

Reviews.Title: Best Deal Ever
Reviews.Author: RTHOMAS HAMILTON
Reviews.Content: Best Camera I ever owned.  Live view is useless.  Turns a great camera into a dumb point and shoot. It is ok for video but not for stills.  Delays the shot.  Still learning some nuances but all in all very similar to my previous Rebel 6.5 mpixil.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as ordered
Reviews.Author: Doug Stubbs
Reviews.Content: Seller accurately described product that arrived. We're elated with this product which allows us, as newbees in photography, to do everything we want to do. This would be an excellent camera for the intermediate user as well. Brand new, exactly as ordered.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: kenny
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a beginners camera to learn more about slr's. So far everything is good, the picture quality is amazing and the touch screen is really nice and convenient. The  body is solid and the functions are easy to switch and adjusts. I'd say overall this camera is well build and good quality. Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to move up from point & shoot, and after watching several reviews by professional photographers on the T4i, I purchased one and I love it more everyday. There are a few professionals on Youtube who have numerous videos that explain all aspects of this camera. I purchased the T4i bundled with the ER-S 55-250mm lens, and since have purchased both the 50mm f/1.4 and the 40mm f/2.8. I'm amazed at how much I've learned, and how many tricks you can do with this camera. I highly recommend it for anybody looking to step into the world of DSLR photography.

Reviews.Title: Change is hard
Reviews.Author: Love2Read
Reviews.Content: I have owned Nikons for many years.  Switching to a Canon has been a hard adjustment.  I am still working at it, but this is a great camera overall.  Would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Marisa Desiderio
Reviews.Content: I am so happy we bought this camera... we have been getting amazing pictures of my 4 month old.  Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Rochelle L Kunkelmann
Reviews.Content: So glad I bought this.  It takes great pics and videos.  Will recommend it to everyone who is looking to get a great camera !!!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Sanchez
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I chose to order this particular camera based on the customer reviews. This product lives up to all of my expectations. Easily upgradable to any add-ons.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic photots
Reviews.Author: Denise Pierce "book addict"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful photos. I'm not very good with it yet as it has so many features and I'm a novice. But, I also purchased a How To Guide that breaks it down better than the manual. Also, just doing is a great teacher.End result, amazing pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures for every occasion
Reviews.Author: Casey Sermons
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to Greece and received nothing but compliments on the photos it took from everyone on my tour. I'm happy that this package came with a lens. I also purchased the 55-250mm lens. Both lens were used on this trip. When you want to capture views of mountains and landscape, the 18-55mm lens worked best. However, when you want to capture details of carvings on the Parthenon (ex Dionysus), you will want to have the 55-250mm lens.I found that both the camera and lens are great together. I only had trouble capturing some flamingos that were located at the salts in Mytilini. I was able to photograph them however the picture is not very detailed since they were about a 1/4 to 1/2 mile away from me and I could not move any closer. I think this type of photograph requires a special lens that a lot of bird watchers use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !
Reviews.Author: iGio
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera in all aspects. The image quality is fine, easy to use, menu is simple and easy to navigate, touchscreen works fine and it is very usable. I use it more then 1 month and performance is outstanding. The battery life is great if used for stills only. Generally, I think this is the camera that fit advanced amateur's photographic needs and I am happy I made this choice.Best within this price range. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Moved up from a Panasonic Lumix and must say -- what a massive difference -- no regrets as I can now capture my kids clearly and with some style as they play sports, ballet etc. Perfect entry point for the novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: new best friend
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: upgraded from xti to this and my god im in love. the shipment was very fast and it was well packaged and safe. it fits with all the lens i already had obviously and works well with my flashes and lights and power grip. very very happy

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: M. Zahid
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good. Easy to use and handle.I have not tried the movie feature and quality yet.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Coach Tom
Reviews.Content: It's so easy my wife and kids can use it.. I just put it in sports mode and it auto focus and snaps continuously taking very nice professional shots.. Must have the 250mm lens, the extra dual battery adapter, filters and case.  We take it to the ball fields weekly for games..  Awesome shots just like the pros.. by the family.  WoW

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!!
Reviews.Author: susan mat
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because i want to take more professional looking  pictures. every year i go to someplace new, and when last year i took my old camera, the standard point and shoot digital cameras, the pictures were horrible. I've had the camera for 6 years and it shot ok pictures, but last year it just sucked. developing the pictures, turks and caicos did not look like i remembered it, so i said to myself: i could go and buy another point and shoot camera or get a more professional camera and get some great pictures and be able to do some great editing with it. I chose the latter, this year i'm going to italy, and i bet i will take better pictures. I'm learning how to use all the features so when i go this summer, i'll be better with it. i'll do another review when i use it to its full potential.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera for the novice to DSLR to the pro.  Very high quality, highly recommend!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "formerly a Road Warrior of t...
Reviews.Content: I shoot mostly nature and animals shots, and recently upgraded from the Canon XS to the Canon T4i.  The T4i has been a splendid camera to use, I have taken numerous photos inside a dark home to have them come out appearing like bright daytime photos, photos taken outdoors in the evening appear to have been taken at dusk.  The DIGIC Imaging processor is very amazing.I highly recommend this camera for both the novice to DSLR photography as well as the professional who is taking nature and outdoor shots. I have been told that Nikon is superior for portrait photography due to Canon's odd handling of the yellow color in images.  Honestly I have not found this to be true on the T4i and have enjoyed the portraits we have taken with the T4i.We also found an adapter ring here on Amazon, now Nikon lenses fit onto our Canon T4i body.  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great choice for my first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Brandy
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR and im so happy i decided for this one. Its easy to use and as a beginner I was able to take amazing pictures. my only wish I guess is to be able to take pictures while on video without the video being interrumpted but I think no camera can do that yet. In general, its a great camera. The charger is too big but hey... what can you do.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this Canon EOS Rebel T4i 18.0 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18-135mm EF-S STM
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I have nothing to complaint.  I am so glad that I made decision of getting this camera.

Reviews.Title: Video features make upgrade worthwhile
Reviews.Author: P&T
Reviews.Content: Upgrading from the Canon Rebel XTI. This model is an upgrade in all ways, but the killer feature for me is the ability to use it as a reasonable video camera. That stops me from having to carry a separate device.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Springsteen "r_springsteen"
Reviews.Content: The camera is the best for the money! and the 18-135mm lens with the STM (stepping Motor) is quite and is a very sharp lens much better than the usual kit lens that comes with it.This is my replacement camera and lens as my first one was stolen.. Gee I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: harry miller
Reviews.Content: My previous cameras included a SLR (Olympus OL2) and a Canon pocket digital. I like the convenience of the digital but I really like the control of the SLR. I considered Nikon and Sony before buying the Canon, but I concluded the Canon the Canon gave me the best quality for money spent. Reviews.Title: Can't wait to go to Italy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I bought this camera, one for each of us, for our trip to Italy later this year. And since we got them, we've been doing lots of practicing, especially me with almost daily shoots. The cameras and the Sigma 18-250mm f3.5-6.3 DC MACRO OS HSM lenses we got with them are so versatile and easy to use for the novice and the pro-sumer alike. I'm having a great time working the in Creative Zone (where you control the exposure and lighting settings), while my fiance is learning to use the Basic Zone (where the settings are chosen by scene and largely automatic). I'm hoping she'll venture into the Creative Zone soon.I do recommend that you work with RAW images. The Digital Photo Professional software that comes with the camera is very powerful for post-processing RAW images. I find that, shooting with post-processing in mind, I focus on proper exposure and composition, framing, and focus, depth of field, etc. In post-processing with DPP, I can adjust minor lighting issues, high ISO noise (if I actually take a high-ISO picture), sharpening, white balance, cropping (because sometimes you just can't frame the picture perfectly when you take it).Another reason for working in the Creative Zone is that this camera, like all other digital cameras I've used, tends to over-expose the photographs. In the Creative Zone I have the exposure compensation set to -2/3. It is much easier to lighten a dark picture than to darken an overexposed picture. In the Basic Zone, you have very little control over this setting -- although some of the scene settings, like Landscape, allow you to select "darker" or "lighter" settings. But still, the Basic Zone is a great starting point when you're just getting to know the camera.One complaint I would make, though, about the Basic Zone is that if you do make some of the allowed adjustments to a scene setting, those changes do not hold when you turn off the camera or select another scene setting. In the Creative Zone, the settings you chose last time are still there when you turn the camera back on for your next shoot.

Reviews.Author: Captain Steak
Reviews.Content: I have used several other DSLR cameras but nothing compares to this. This camera is packed with tons of features and depends on which setting you have the camera in is whether you can mess with them or not. For example, if in auto mode, you cannot change much at all. The other awesome feature is the touch screen. The screen has a button with a Q on it, stands for quick access if I recall, which is used to mess around with several features. And the greatest feature, to me and any beginner photographer, is the helpful hints. Hit the Q to change a setting, then click on what you want to change. This will then pop up a small window to tell you what this feature does. Of course this does mean you have to click twice to change a setting, but wait, if these information pop ups get annoying, you can just go into the menu and turn them off.Another feature, which is outlined in the product description, is the HDR Backlight. All I can say is that this works exactly as described. Accessing this mode is just a simple mode switch on the dial. You can also have some fun with this if you are shooting a live subject, a person or animal or such, and create ghosting. This happens since this mode takes 3 photos in a row and than compiles them together.There is still much that I am learning about this camera. There is just so many features to discover. I have not even touched the video mode as of yet. The live view I am still figuring out as well. But if you are thinking of buying a camera, this one is a great buy. And if you have any concerns, feel free to comment or message me and I will give you more information.

Future plans are to purchase a mid level telephoto lens, I just have the kit lens (18-55mm). It takes pictures quite fast for shooting bursts, it's stated I believe to do 5 frames in a blink of an eye. I was on the fence about this model or the previous one, I picked this one due to myself playing with both models at a retail store. Battery life is great IMO, but I would suggest buying a spare for vacations and such. I believe I will continue to stick with canon cameras for future upgrades. I would recommend this product to anyone wanting to make a step into DSLR cameras, but try the T3I and the T4I at a store and make a decision the previous version is a great buy now but I was more impressed with the T4I. Thank you canon and amazon for prompt delivery and service.

Reviews.Title: Wow ...oh wow!! Great camera for a novice like me!
Reviews.Author: Pirate Morgan "thepiratemorgan"
Reviews.Content: Even a novice "picture taker" like me can take absolute great (IMO) pics with this camera. Absolutely one of the best purchases I have made all year (well, it is only March...LOL). I suggest a little reading, "Canon T4i for Dummies" or David Busch's Canon T3i Guide (similar model, almost all information carry's over to T4i seamlessly). You can take pics that are 100x better than a "point 'n' shoot" using just Auto Mode and the included 18-55mm lens. This camera lets you grow into it as you learn more. Soon you will move on to "Creative Auto" and then straight into "Manual". You'll be blurring image backgrounds and setting scenes in no time at all. Inside pics without a flash? No problem. Yeah, the price point for such luxury is somewhat steep, but these camera's (and more importantly, lenses) have some resale value that carry on for quite some time. So instead of a "throw away" point 'n' shoot, this is at least a slightly better investment. Remember, you're buying into a "system" and company so be sure to do your homework. Canon has been a leader in the dSLR industry for years and years. There are other big names out there, and all should be considered. Reviews.Title: The best DSLR camera for
Reviews.Author: DP5984
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel T4i is the best. Place the Rebel T4i alongside its predecessor, the EOS 600D / Rebel T3i, and the similarity in design and specifications may suggest nothing more than a nominal upgrade.Indeed the headline specifications - 18MP CMOS sensor, 9-point AF sensor, 3:2 flip-out 1.04m dot screen are all familiar from the 600D. Look a bit closer, however, and each of these has been significantly improved, with an eye both to more seasoned users who demand SLR performance and compact camera upgraders who want a familiar feeling interface. The Rebel T4i also gains significance because it forms the basis of the Canon EOS M, the company's long-awaited entry into the mirrorless interchangeable lens market.It is largely because of the rise of large sensor mirrorless models that in today's market an entry-level DSLR must offer more than just high image quality to entice compact camera upgraders. In the age of YouTube, quick and easy access to video recording capability is a must. And for users that are far more familiar with composing via an LCD screen than a viewfinder, live view performance is of no small concern. Of course the camera must still offer users a path to a more traditional DSLR-like experience, without which, they would be hard pressed to resist the temptation of a physically smaller 'mirrorless' camera.The Rebel T4i is Canon's attempt to meet these challenges head on, with new features aimed at improving its live view and video performance. It becomes Canon's first DSLR to offer continuous AF tracking while recording movies.This is made possible by Canon's new 'Hybrid CMOS' sensor that now includes pixels dedicated to phase detection autofocus. The Hybrid AF system uses these to quickly set the lens to roughly the correct distance, then uses contrast detection AF to fine-tune focus. In theory, this should provide faster and more certain focusing for live view and video shooting compared to previous Canon models which rely on CDAF alone. You can read a more detailed explanation of this technology and see it in action on the AF performance page of this review.The Rebel T4i also becomes the first SLR from any manufacturer to feature a touchscreen. This is of the capacitive (contact sensitive) rather than resistive (pressure sensitive) type, behaving like that of a typical smartphone. In Live View and Movie modes the screen can be used to specify the point of focus and (optionally) release the shutter. It also supports iPhone-like multi-touch and gestures. The rear screen has been redesigned with no air gap between the display and cover glass in an attempt to reduce reflections and improve visibility in bright light. There's also an anti-smudge coating which aims to reduce the impact of its newfound touch-sensitivity.

I had an opportunity to photograph her dance students again in a High School auditorium, with the Canon T4i. I used the same lens that I used for recital,no flash, same low light conditions. Both times the camera was set in sports mode. I didn't have to delete a single picture because of action blur.The pictures were breathtaking.
